loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Despite her young age, Ani is an experienced farmer from Arevshat village. She lives with her husband, son, parents-in-law, grandmother-in-law and brother-in-law. Ani's husband works for the private sector, and her grandmother-in-law receives a retirement pension. However, their salaries are not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Ani is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat, barley, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots and greens. Her family helps her in selling the agricultural produce in the local market. All the family work hard to earn a living. 

The requested loan of USD 2500 will be a huge help to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to  purchase wheat seeds (700 kgs), cover cultivation costs,  and buy forage for feeding the livestock. 

Since this is Ani's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Ani and her family rely on the good will of the lenders. They will be grateful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to run their agricultural business in a more efficient way.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds (700 kgs), cover cultivation costs  and buy forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik is an experienced agronomist from Marzpetuni village. Her family consists of her husband and two school age children.

Nazik is engaged in keeping cows and cultivating tomato, eggplant, pepper, peaches, apricot, quinces, pears and apple. Her husband helps her by taking the agricultural products to the local market. Farming is a very important source of income for them. 

The family's daily needs are increasing with time, and Nazik wants to enlarge her livestock holdings to be able to meet those needs. She is requesting a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase wheat seed (300 kgs), two oxen, forage for feeding the cattle, and to cover other cultivation costs. 

The loan will greatly help to sustain her agribusiness. Nazik and her family will highly appreciate the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, two oxen, cattle feed, and to cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new housewares for her house.

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hwefo Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four hardworking and successful business people, who have businesses providing different services: selling groceries, foodstuff and clothing materials. 

Janet, the featured borrower is 43 years old, single, and a mother of two. She is the owner of a 'chopbar' (cooking joint) where she sells different types of local dishes. She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients (garden eggs, peppers, tomatoes, fish, cassava, plantain, etc.) to prepare foods to sell to customers. Janet has been making a good profit in this business since she buys ingredients at wholesale prices and sells the prepared food to the customers at the retail price. 

Together, the group members will need a total amount of 3,400 GHS to be able to serve their customers better. They have been together for many years and this is their third loan cycle. They will hold one another responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (garden eggs, peppers, tomatoes, fish, cassava, plantain, etc.) at wholesale prices to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman, and she has seven children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Nancy operates a retail business where she sells fruits, cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Nancy will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, cereals and vegetables. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Nancy's previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Josphina

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Josphina, 47 years of age and a proud mother of four. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Josphina loves farming, taking really good care of her dairy cows and even nicknaming her cow. 

The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming: good soil, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Josphina wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to get her started and, through improved income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure her children's futures. The financial benefits that Josphina will reap are almost immediate; hence, she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profit.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Abdulrazak

texts.en: Abdulrazak is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulrazak would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to take care of his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrazak can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Abdulrazak is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses such as food, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salisu M

texts.en:
Salisu  M is a maize farmer from Nassarawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Salisu  M would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu  M can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Salisu  M, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zakaria Lawal

texts.en: Zakaria Lawal is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakaria Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakaria Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Zakaria Lawal is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to store his maize, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita has been in the fishing business for 25 years now. She and her family live in Iloilo. Her husband is also a fisherman and she helps him in ensuring that all needed fishing equipment is well taken care of and also in selling his catch. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat, engine, and gill nets. This way, they can focus on their fishing activities without worrying about the quality of their tools and equipment. 

Any income generated from this business will be used for the tuition fees of her children aged 11, 16 and 18. In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business to help provide for her children's future and for her family's savings.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, engine and gill nets.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri lives in Artik town with her husband, parents-in-law and two school-age children. She has been running her clothing store in the center of Artik town for already three years. 

The breadwinners of the family are Meri and her husband. In the present difficult social conditions, it is very difficult to cover the daily costs of the family. However, thanks to her hard work, Meri has been able to establish and run her small business. She currently wants to maintain her business and increase the sales. 

To reach that goal, she needs to sell more products in her local shop. A loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support to Meri and her family. The loan will help her to buy a new assortment of clothes for women. This will make her small shop more competitive, and her business more sustainable. Meri and her family will be grateful to the lenders who will assist with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a new assortment of clothes for women

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man, and he has two children. He describes himself to be honest. 

Samuel operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Samuel will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Meet Jeniffer, a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for mango farming. Jeniffer and her husband are blessed with four children, whom she has fought so hard to raise. For the past 10 years, Jeniffer has been actively involved in mixed farming; her primary sources of income have been milk, varieties of crops and poultry farming. She sells her produce to the nearby market and to neighbors, and has been making positive strides. 

Jeniffer is seeking a loan to start poultry farming and to be able to make her dream come true. She is very passionate about poultry farming, and the most enjoyable task is raising the poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people. Jeniffer does not have to worry about competition because the market is there and this will assure her of high profits and improved living conditions. Through the loan, Jeniffer will be able to benefit from manure from the birds and to sell eggs, meat and feathers, thus boosting her income level. Additional profits from poultry will permanently change her life, and she will be able to take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Ancachuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Karina, la socia tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como chanchos, la socia  lleva buen tiempo de dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganadería y negocio de crianza de animales.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank TRES DE MAYO DE ANACHURO. This bank is located in the district of Anta which is in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.  The featured member is Karina, she is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has one son. The member alternates her daily activities with raising small animals, such as pigs. She has been working in this business for a while, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She raises animals to later sell them to her customers that request them in different fairs that take place throughout the region. The member wants to keep working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.
The member has requested this loan to buy food for her animals.

The other members work in agriculture, run a grocery store, sell cattle, and raise animals.
The member whose picture has been cropped into the photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons, and the member whose face has been covered does not belong to the community bank. 

Karina is grateful to the people who form part of her dream in this way and promises to make her repayments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. Her husband provides additional income for the family.

Mary sells groceries, a business she has done for the last theee years, earning a monthly income of Kshs.17,000.

Mary has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs.10,000, which she will use to increase her business stock by buying fruits in season and indigenous vegetables for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to increase her business stock by buying fruits in season and indigenous vegetables

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en: Istifanus is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Istifanus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Istifanus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Istifanus is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to cover immediate expenses like food, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is an agronomist from Arshaluys village, in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, two sons and a retired father-in-law. To be able to meet the everyday needs of the family, Gohar is engaged in the cultivation of potato, greens and watermelon. 
Her husband helps her a lot by selling the agricultural products in the market. As life gets more expensive, the family's everyday costs are also increasing. Gohar now needs to enlarge the cultivation work and improve greenhouse to be able to meet her family's needs more effectively. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a great support to Gohar and her family, helping them to purchase potato seeds, a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agribusiness. As this Gohar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, a polyethylene cover and wires for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in unrefined whole sugar, coconut, milk, etc.

loans.name: Saeb

texts.en: Saeb is a 48-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who started working nine years ago as a car electrician to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Saeb has a good reputation within his region for he is a hard worker with professional skills. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with new spare parts to facilitate his work and provide his customers with better service. Saeb hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new spare parts.

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven se ha sabido ganar la vida, y es por ello que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas sopas de pata, tortillas de nixtamal y quesadillas de arroz, estos deliciosos platillos son muy solicitados en su cantón y los alrededores. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos. Blanca con su negocio ha logrado salir adelante, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en productos como: harina de arroz, azúcar, queso, patas, tomates, cebolla, apio, maíz, cal, etc. Para preparar los ricos platillos que vende y de los que tanto gustan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hardworking woman that from a young age has known how to make a living.  Therefore, for 15 years she has made a living making and selling rich duck soups, corn tortillas, and rice quesadillas.  These delicious dishes are highly sought after in her town and the surrounding area.  She lives in her own house together with her life partner and their two children.  

Blanca has succeeded with her business.  This is why she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI that will allow her to invest in products such as rice flour, sugar, cheese, ducks, tomatoes, onion, garlic, corn, lime, etc.  She will be able to prepare the rich dishes that she sells and that her customers like so much.

loans.use: To invest in rice flour, sugar, cheese, ducks, tomatoes, onion, garlic, corn, lime, etc.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre en su adolescencia,  no estudio y se dedicó a trabajar en el campo; actualmente es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, apoya con los gastos familiares.
Le será de ayuda el préstamo para invertir en insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno en el que podrá cultivar granos básicos, seguirá realizando está actividad para tener ingresos económicos, además práctica la crianza de ganado.
Sus aspiraciones son tener una mejor cosecha, tener ingresos para resarcir su deuda y apoyar  a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
José makes a living performing agricultural jobs, a trade that he learned from his father as a teen.  He did not go to school, and he decided to work in the fields.  He is still single and lives in his parents' house supporting the family expenses.

The loan will be helpful to him to invest in agricultural inputs to prepare the land so that he can grow basic grains.  He will continue performing this job to have income, in addition to practicing cattle breeding.

His biggest aspirations are to have a better crop, to have income to pay off his debt, and to support his parents economically.

loans.use: To invest in agricultural inputs to prepare the land so that he can grow basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy household appliances for personal use.

loans.name: Janif

texts.en: Janif is a 29 years old and operates a general store business where she sells soap, sugar, benny, biscuits, tea leaves, etc.  Janif is working in the local area actively assisting in the creation of business. Janif requested a loan which she will use to purchase more items to sell in her store. She hopes the extra income will help to provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Juliana is the featured borrower of this group that hails from Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. She is 43 years old and is married with one child. She has a small family comprised of three members, including one child who is in school. With the help of her husband, she has been in the assorted soap and eggs selling business for the last eight years. Presently, her monthly family income is good, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life. This is her fourth loan from ID-Ghana. With this loan, she will purchase assorted soap and eggs in bulk to sell to customers. Her future plan is to construct a house and to provide a higher education for her child. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support. The other members of this group are involved in different business activities; the other members are involved in hair dressing and cooking rice and stew.

loans.use: to purchase assorted soap and eggs in bulk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Shalon Group

texts.es: Grupo Shalon integrado por tres socias laboriosas y emprendedoras en su vida laboral, es coordinado por la señora Aleyda quien tiene la edad de 48 años, casada y madre de un hijo, quien ha sido su motivo de superación y se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, frutas, accesorios para la realización de la comida, mesas, sillas, etc; con el crédito anterior logro cubrir la demanda y satisfacer a sus clientes. Otra de las integrantes es doña Keyla de 23 años de edad, y se dedica a la compra - venta de ropa nueva y doña Rosa tiene la edad de 48 años y se dedica a la comercialización de perfumes.
texts.en:
Grupo Shalon is made of three laborious and enterprising partners in the working life.  It is coordinated by Aleyda who is 48 years old, is married and the mother of one son, who has been her overcoming motive.  She has made a living selling food for five year.

The loan that she is requesting is for buying basic grain, vegetables, fruits, accessories for food production, tables, chairs, etc.  With the previous loan she met the demand of her customers.

Another of the members is Keyla, 23 years old, who works in the buying and selling of new clothes.  Rosa is 48 years old, and she works marketing perfumes.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, accessories for food production, tables, chairs, with the goal of improving her sales.

loans.name: Bernard Okaitey

texts.en:
Bernard is a young man pursuing a three-year program in Mechanical Engineering at the Accra Technical Training Institute. The loan he is requesting will be used to help pay for his school fees and textbooks.

The professional path Bernard has chosen is a result of the interest he has in creating and recreating things. He believes the completion of his studies would benefit his family and community financially, because he would be able to provide them with some of their basic needs.

Bernard's father, an auto body mechanic, has always been an inspiration to him, because he teaches Bernard how to use both his hands and metal to create meaningful objects through careful reasoning.

Bernard sees himself as a manager of a big engineering company with about fifty workers. However, without the education and needed skills he will not achieve this goal. If Bernard is denied this loan, his dreams cannot be met.

Bernard would like the world to know that his country is a good place to invest; therefore there is good reason for them to keep doing the good work to help the less privileged.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Cebu Group

texts.en:
Lucila is the featured borrower of Cebu Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They trust each other since they came from the Philippines to work hard to cover their families' living.

Lucila is a 44-year-old married mother of one child, who works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved family with the necessary standard of living. The loan she has applied for will be sent to her family back in the Philippines to cover her child's increasing living needs expenses and educational needs. She has a good standing and history of paying back loans. Her previous Al Majmoua loans helped her a lot in covering her child's school tuition fees.

Lucila is the first lady standing at the far right side of the picture. The other group members are Rhoda, who is at the center, and Annabelle, who is the first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for her child's education fees

loans.name: Hụ

texts.en:
Mrs. Hụ has a retail business selling dry food. Hụ is 64 years old and she is married with 4 children. Hụ lives and does her business in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hụ has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hụ has been involved in this business for a year. 

The main hardship that Hụ faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hụ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand, cement to build a toilet.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a young farmer from Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is the mother of three children and has been doing farming for the last ten years so that she can supplement her income from the small business she does. 

Selly does crop farming and cattle keeping and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and diseases. This has made her seek a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sheep. Her projections are that by the end of the year these sheep will have given birth to at least four other sheep. 

Through sheep-keeping, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives with her mother in Zuygaghbyur village, Shirak region. Tereza is an enthusiastic woman. She drives a taxi using her own car, as well as running her small farm. The main activity that Tereza is involved in during the season is vegetable sales. 

To be able to look after her mother, Tereza works day and night. She is asking for this loan of USD 2,000 to be able to purchase forage to feed the livestock - she needs 400 packages - during the winter season. Because of the cold weather, the only activity that she does in winter is cattle breeding so the loan is very important for her. 

Tereza will be grateful to the lenders who will help her to collect the needed amount for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season.

loans.name: Não

texts.en:
Mrs. Não works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Não is 61 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Não faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In 2003, Não joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Não has successfully repaid one loan from FPW. With her business profit, Não hopes to maintain a successful business. She wants her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build a toilet

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business and educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high competition. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open another branch within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a great seller of cereals in her area. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a young agronomist from the village of Khndzoresk in Syunik region. She lives with her husband and two-year-old son. The family is engaged in breeding cows, calves and hens, and this is their only source of income.  

Because things are getting more expensive day by day, the family need to enlarge their agribusiness to be able to cover their expenses. That is why Meri needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase two cows and forage for feeding cattle. She wants 500 packages of forage. This is her’s first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF which provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit before, because they have no credit history. 

Meri and her husband will be very thankful to their lenders for their good will in helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as honest. 

Samuel operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. Samuel's business is well-located in an area conducive to his customers, who are mainly individuals buying retail. 

Samuel will use his 20,000 KES loan in order to purchase more carpentry materials. 

His business goal is to be a great carpenter within 5 years. This is Samuel's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more carpentry materials

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables, soap and other items. Her business goal is to open a cereals store in the area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best supplier of vegetables and cereals. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, soap and other items.

loans.name: Bruneilla

texts.en:
Bruneilla is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as industrious. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. 

She hopes that in the future, her business will prosper. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are mostly women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Omorde Bor Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Omorde Bor (Be purposeful) and they are on their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include underwear, cereals, cassava and corn dough. The loan that they will receive will benefit micro businesses like Dorothy's. 

This is Dorothy's third year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling underwear. She began this business through a cousin, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product. The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase more underwear and sell to men, women and children. She will purchase the product from the main market and later sell to customers. 

This job allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has one child. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind and very determine to improve their condition.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell for men, women and children.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells medicine and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine and cosmetics. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more assorted biscuits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is from Isahakyan village. His big family includes his father, brother, wife, three sons and a daughter-in-law. Gevorg is a farmer with many years of experience in running a farm. He keeps livestock (cows, sheep, calves, pigs and hens) and cultivates wheat. Each family member has a specific task on the farm. Gevorg's wife gets the milk, meat, and agricultural products, and the family earn its living by selling them. 

To sustain his farm, Gevorg asks for this loan of USD 3,000. It will enable him to purchase fertilizer, fuel for land cultivation, barley seeds (one tonne) and two tires for the tractor. 

Gevorg and his big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel for land cultivation, barley seeds (one tonne) and two tires for the tractor

loans.name: Amani Suka Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children who are still in school.  She  has been running a beauty salon for two years now.  She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zainabu's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy up-to-date  salon products.  She dreams of selling things like women bags and clothes in her salon shop.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group "Amani Suka" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy   up-to-date  salon products.

loans.name: Arecio Damian

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive don Arecio, tiene 43 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 11 años de edad, la mayor estudia en un colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es costurera.
El señor Arecio es un hombre muy trabajador que hace todo lo posible para que a su familia no les falte nada, el tiene un deposito  en su casa donde vende agua, helados, colas, yogurt, pony malta y varias bebidas mas, son muchas las personas que llegan todos los días a comprar sus productos ya sea al por mayor o al menudeo. Lleva más de 16  años con este negocio con  el cual se gana lo suficiente para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua, colas, yogurt y todo de lo que el vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the credit group Las Mercedes del Fátima meet in the city of Portoviejo. This group is mostly made up of hard-working, humble people who struggle to raise their families. This is where Arecio lives.  He is 43 years old and is married.  He and his wife have two children who are 11 and 16 years old, both of whom are in school. His wife is a seamstress.

Arecio is a very hard worker and does everything he possibly can to make sure his family has everything they need. He has a space in his house from which he sells water, ice cream, soft drinks, yogurt, Pony Malta (low alcohol beer), and various other beverages. Many people buy from him each day, both wholesale and retail. He has been doing this for 16 years and has earned enough to support his family. 

He will use this loan to buy water, soft drinks, yogurt and everything that he sells. He has had three cycles with this credit group and he likes it because of the helpfulness of the loans. His dreams are to continue improving his business.

loans.use: to buy water, soft drinks, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet es una madre soltera que tiene 41 anos y 3 hijos. Ella es muy emprendedora y tiene su tienda de aborrotes. En su tiendita se vende varias cosas como ropa, lana, libros. La cliente solicita el credito para poder comprar mas productos como materiales de tejido y costura para su tienda. Yanet esta muy agradecida por ser cliente de Arariwa y por tener accesso al capital. Se ha comprometido pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en: Yanet is a 41 year old,  single mother with three children. She is very enterprising. She has a grocery store. In her little store, she sells a variety of products like clothing, wool and books. The client is requesting a loan to purchase more products like knitting and sewing materials for her store. Yanet is very grateful to be a client of Araiwa and to have access to capital. She is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase more products like knitting and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Esther Yarbawa

texts.en:
Esther Yarbawa is a maize farmer from Lumu village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Esther Yarbawa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther Yarbawa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Esther Yarbawa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Zina from Yenoqavan village. She is an agronomist, living with her husband and their only son. Zina's son is a taxi driver and her husband is involved in a retail business. 

To sustain their living, the family is also involved in agriculture. Both Zina's husband and son help her with farming activities, but the main worker in the farm is Zina. She takes care of the farm with great love and pleasure as it fills all her day. 

To sustain and enlarge her farming business, Zina is asking for this loan of USD 1,500. It will enable her to purchase a pig, forage for feeding the livestock and pay to repair the tractor. Zina will be grateful to the lenders who will help her to collect the needed amount for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, forage for feeding the livestock and to repair the tractor.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Sabuwar Abuja village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Cindy Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Cindy, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es policía. 
Doña Cindy es una joven  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a realizar sus recorridos tres o cuatro días por semana, en las horas que sabe que puede encontrar a sus clientes ya sea en la mañana o en las noches, deja a crédito esta mercadería y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 5 años dedicada esta actividad la cual les sirve de mucho para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the credit group Las Mercedes Del Fátima get together. This group is mostly made up of humble and hardworking people who fight to get their family ahead. This is where 27-year-old Cindy lives. She is in a common law marriage, from which she has two children ages 8 and 4 who go to school. Her husband is a policeman. Cindy is a young woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses and to help raise their small children. She works in trade, selling clothing and shoes from a catalog. She goes door to door selling three or four times a week during the hours that she knows she'll find her customers at home- in the morning or at night. She lets them buy the merchandise on credit and charges them every eight or fifteen days. She's done this for over five years which has helped their family get ahead.

She'll use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and shoes. She's been with the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because she's able to use the loans to get ahead. Her dream is to give her children all the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix his truck and purchase new tires.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Group

texts.en:
Himadri is a permanent resident of village Sargadi of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She hails from a Schedule caste family. Schedule Caste people in India are considered to be the most backward. Around 95% of the people of this caste are socially and economically backward. Steps are being taken by the government and NGOs in respect to education, empowerment, employment and livelihood to triumph over this situation. 

The young and confident lady standing with a raised hand in the photo is Himadri. She is a married lady of 27 years having two daughters who are seven and three years old. She resides with her husband and two daughters in a small house. 

Himadri has been running a paddy milling unit in her village for the last last five years. Her husband manages this unit. Villagers from the nearby 10-15 villages come to her mill to mill their paddy rice. As there are no other rice hullers in the nearby area, the number of customers is increasing regularly. Therefore Himadri is planning to increase her income by expanding the business. 

So she along with other thirteen women formed a Self Help group named Maa Saraswati and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Looking into the demand of the locality, from her present loan she wants to purchase another rice huller. She is certain that this will generate a handsome of income for her. 

Himadri hopes to save enough money to build a permanent house for her paddy milling unit, construct a good house for her family and give better education to her children. The other members of the group are doing different types of business like vegetable vending, fish vending, fabrication unit, cycle repairing center, barber shop, animal trading etc.

loans.use: To purchase another rice huller.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is a jewelry artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted silver pieces. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs. Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "My childhood was spent appreciating nature's beauty, like the Pacific Ocean with its colorful fish, blue waters, sand, rocks and sunsets. In the Andes, I came into contact with the culture of my ancestors, the Inca. Then I visited the Amazon rainforest. I began designing jewelry and then went on to craft everything I see in silver and precious stones. Some of my friends tell me I'm a dreamer. I tell them that the only way to create is first to dream." "My goal is to use this microcredit to build up a good inventory of pieces to sell during this holiday season." Use the link below to view Luis's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5549

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra has been working with children for over 20 years, both as a case worker and as a single mother. She says because of her experience, “I know how people struggle with child care.” 

She runs a children’s daycare re out of her home and employs 2 part-time workers.  Her business is in Queens, NY.

Sandra needs a loan to purchase more supplies for her daycare – including more toys for the kids! Also, she would like to build a website – right now, customers find her through word of mouth.

This is Sandra's second Kiva loan. Her prior loan helped her purchase supplies and toys for her daycare. Her new loan will continue to help with supply purchases, but also allow Sandra to build her own website and help grow her marketing strategy.

loans.use: to build her website.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 50 years old, widowed and a mother to 4 children. She has a mobile money transfer business in Kitengela town. She has been running this business for 5 years and it has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to rent a shop and be able to open another mobile money transfer business so she can serve more customers and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future her hopes are to open more businesses and be successful.

loans.use: To rent a shop and open another mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 26 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 2 años,  el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Jessenia es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene un taller de ebanistería, allí el  elabora puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares, una de las cosas por cual a su esposo no le falta el trabajo es por el buen trabajo que realiza y por la responsabilidad ya que entrega los trabajos en el día indicado, el lleva 8 años con su taller y gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en  pcomprar madera, laca, pinturas y otros materialesara elaborar los muebles. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sentirse útil. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "24 De Diciembre" [December 24th] Communal Bank meets once every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts, and home of the famous straw hats. 

This is where Jessenia, age 26, lives. She is married, and she and her husband have two children, ages nine and two.   The older one goes to school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

Jessenia is a very good wife who wants to take out a loan for her husband to use in his work. Her husband has a cabinet making business.  At his workshop he makes doors, beds, and all types of furniture. Jessenia's husband works filling orders from customers.   One reason he always has work is that he does a good job, as well as because he is responsible about completing orders on time. 

He has had his workshop for eight years and, thankfully, he has almost always had work. 

This loan will be used to buy wood, shellac, paint, and other materials for making furniture.

Jessenia has been in the communal bank since its inception.  She likes it because with the loans she is able to feel useful.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, shellac, paint, and other materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
Levi is a 69-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Levi has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Levi described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Levi’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and has six children. She is a group leader, and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as poor, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds and change in fashion. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bicycles.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a Mexican artisan who specializes in steel sculptures and wall art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sheet metal for his designs. Alejandro has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story: "From the time I was a boy, I was attracted to art. When I was 20, I became an ecologist and defender of nature, and this is when I began to create animals in metal. My technique is similar to cutout metal, but more rudimentary. From this, I became inspired and started working in metal for its versatility. Today I have a workshop, a cockatoo named Coco and a cactus collection. Those are all the tools I need to continue working." "Thanks for being part of the engine that allows us to reach our dreams." Use the link below to view Alejandro's steel sculptures and wall art on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6884

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sheet metal for his designs.

loans.name: Antoni

texts.en:
Antoni is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Antoni would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Antoni can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Antoni is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and food.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in hand-tooled wood and leather furniture and decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs. Julio has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "My uncle was a was a master craftsman who worked with wood and leather, and I learned from him. When I was just 12, he let me begin finishing small pieces like leather trunks and jewelry boxes. I loved the work so much that I'd swipe pieces of leather from other people in the workshop to practice leather embossing on my own. My art is a family heritage, handed down over generations." "This microcredit will allow me to purchase the raw material I need to craft more items ahead of the holiday rush. I am grateful to everyone who helps make this possible." Use the link below to view Julio's hand-tooled wood and leather furniture and decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8432

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy musk ducks and food for them

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni is an artisan from Java who specializes in silk batik shawls and scarves. She would like to invest in the purchase of tools and raw materials, including raw silk fabric and batik colors.

Yuni has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I learned the art of batik when I was very young from my mother. She has been making batik at home in Java for over 23 years, while waiting each day for my father to come home from the sea. We still design together, especially the floral and bird motifs that are typical in Pekalongan batik. My husband also helps me a lot, but as a local Balinese woman, I'm very proud of the fact that I can have the career that I love, and be able to provide for myself and my family.

I am thankful for your support. I plan to add new designs and keep my inventory at a good level during this holiday season. Thank you so much for your kind heart. I hope my business can keep developing. You are a part of my success."

Use the link below to view Yuni's silk batik shawls and scarves on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5981

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tools and raw materials, including raw silk fabric and batik colors.

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en:
Dorothy's Group is formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Dorothy, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 33 years old, is married and has 3 children. Dorothy has been a farmer for 9 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Dorothy isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has a larger farm group support ever since. This year, Dorothy will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Dorothy's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Juana Luzmila

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer que día a día se esfuerza y trabaja incansablemente para poder convertirse en un ejemplo de superación de sus hijos, es por ello que desde hace más de 1 años labora en el área de mantenimiento y limpieza de una empresa de su ciudad natal, Pisco. 
Ella no pudo estudiar una profesión porque salió salió embarazada, es por ello que quiere un futuro diferente para sus hijos y no se cansa de inculcar en ellos muchos valores y brindarles consejos para que puedan crecer como personas de bien.
Como toda una persona emprendedora, ahora que se acerca Navidad, Juana quiere vender ropa por fiestas, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar la mercadería necesaria para sus ventas. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque gracias a estos ingresos adicionales que obtendrá va a mejorar su calidad de vida y más adelante espera brindar una educación superior a sus engreídos.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman who makes an effort and works tirelessly every day in order to become an example of improvement for her children. It is for this reason that for over a year she has been working in the area of maintenance and cleaning for a company in her hometown, Pisco.

She could not study a profession because she got pregnant. She wants a different future for her children, and she does not get tired of teaching them many values and giving them advise so that they can grow up to be good people.

As an entrepreneurial person, Juana wants to sell clothing for the holidays now that Christmas is approaching. She plans to use the loan to buy the necessary merchandise for her sales. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity. With the additional income that she will obtain, she will improve her quality of life. In the future, she hopes to give her spoiled children a superior education.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Joina's Group

texts.en:
Joina, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Joina will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Joina plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a goat.

In total Joina’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by John, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 59 years old, is married and has 4 children. John has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

John isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, John will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, John's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and a solar light.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Maryamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Japheth's Group

texts.en:
Japheth is a 71-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Japheth has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Japheth described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Japheth’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Amilia's Group

texts.en:
Amilia is 57 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hard-working individual. Even though Amilia is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Amilia started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Amilia’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 16 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tabitha's Group

texts.en:
Tabitha's Group is formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Tabitha, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 33 years old, is married and has 3 children. Tabitha has been a farmer for 6 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Tabitha isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Tabitha will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Tabitha's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and two solar lights.

loans.name: Truphena's Group

texts.en:
Truphena is a 72-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Truphena has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Truphena described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Truphena’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Marygorety's Group

texts.en:
Marygorety is 62 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Marygorety has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Marygorety also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Marygorety's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel is 63 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Samwel has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Samwel also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Samwel's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and two solar lights.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes that she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mary has also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night and to have somewhere to charge her phone.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Vilma, la socia continua dedicándose a alquilar habitaciones para familia o estudiantes quienes le solicitan, la socia  lleva buen tiempo continuando con su  negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales  y de esta manera le permite poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para el arreglo de un cuarto.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
La socia que aparece en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district within the Cusco province and department. 
The member is Vilma. She continues to rent rooms to family or students who seek them. She is doing well with her business which brings her personal satisfaction. This allows her to continue supporting her family. Vilma is grateful to those who are part of this dream. She is committed to making her payments on time. 
She is requesting a loan to arrange a room.
The other members are dedicated to a bookstore, selling clothing, a grocery store and a taxi service. 
The member in the attached photo asked to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: arrange a bedroom.

loans.name: Ángela Victoria

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 12 años que  estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un barco pesquero.
Doña Ángela es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que demandan los estudios de sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de buscar sus propios ingresos, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales ofrece sus productos, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace 5 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un barco propio.
texts.en:
“The 24th of December Credit Group” meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisan crafts, recognized at the national and international level. This is where they make the famous [Panama] hats from 'toquilla' straw.

Angela lives here. She is 37 years old, married, and from this relationship has sprung four children, ages 17, 15, 14, and 12, all of whom study at school. Her husband works on a fishing boat. Angela is a good wife who, in order to help her husband with the expenses, especially the demanding costs of educating their children, has found it necessary to make her own income. She sells clothing of all types door-to-door and at home. Angela has some glass display cases in which she displays her goods. She gives her customers credit and collects each month. Angela buys her merchandise in Guayaquil when needed. She has had her business for five years, having started with her first loan.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, undershirts and children's clothing.

Angela has belonged to this credit group for five years and she like it because she began her business with these loans. Her dream is to have her own [fishing] boat.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, undershirts and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is 42 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Stephen has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Stephen also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Stephen's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elisha's Group

texts.en:
Elisha is a 75-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader and is often described as a very resourceful person. He is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Elisha notes that since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Elisha described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Elisha’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Franciscah's Group

texts.en:
