Franciscah is 38 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Franciscah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Franciscah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Franciscah's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yazmin Gabriela

texts.en: Yazmin is 22 years old, married and has a small baby. She sells shoes and other items through a catalog. She sells to her friends and neighbors. She is asking for a loan to buy shoes for the Christmas season. She says that this time of the year, most of her clients ask her for newer models for the holidays. Her goal is to become independent and support her baby.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.en:
Karla is 20 years old and she has a store in which she sells products for home cleaning. She is asking for a loan to buy two small carts to be able to sell products around her neighborhood. She own a small store, but she wants to be able to also sell door-to-door.  

Karla is single and lives with her parents. She says that her biggest accomplishment is starting her business two years ago. She now has a local clientele and wants to keep growing her business.

loans.use: To expand her home cleaning products business.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 36 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 17 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Everlyne is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by eight farmers from the Kakamega North district, Kenya.

Everlyne started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago in 2010. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Everlyne’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Kenjekkul

texts.ru: Кенжекул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Кенжекул есть 1 корова, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь, 4 овец, 4 ягнят, 5 коз и 5 козлят. На участке мерою 0,40 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжекул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят, для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кенжекул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Kenjekkul has successfully paid off her loan and used it as intended. She is very thankful to the Kiva Fund and all those who helped finance her loan. Today Kenjekkul has one cow, one calf, one horse, four sheep, four lambs, five goats and five kids. She grows corn for use in her business on the 4.0 hectares of land. Kenjekkul has come to Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to further grow her business and buy calves to increase the headcount of cattle. She plans to use the income from the loan to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves in order to increase headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce lives in Baucau; she is married and she has 6 children. She has been involved in business activities since 2007. She started with her own working capital of $20. 

She is a tailor and she also sells goods from a stall. So she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials such as sewing needles, sewing thread, and other materials including candy, shampoo, milk, and soft drinks. 

She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business because she hopes to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sewing needles, thread, and items for resale.

loans.name: Magaret's Group

texts.en:
Magaret is a 38-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Magaret has noted that since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Magaret described her harvest as good last year but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Magaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is 49 years old. He is divorced and has three children; two are independent and he supports the youngest one. Pedro began working as a taxi driver five years ago, and says that his biggest accomplishment was being able to acquire his taxi. He is asking for a loan to do some car repairs in order to keep working. He works six days a week from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m.

loans.use: to fix his taxi.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
After running several loans cycles, the Sari Karya group paid off their loan on time. Still with fattening, piglets seller and pig barbeque programs, they enjoyed borrowing a loan from MUK. It’s because they can form into a group, get trained and the loan doesn't need collateral from the borrower, but they are very responsible for the loan.

Ni Ketut, as the head of the group, sold her piglets after managing them for two months. She’s a piglet seller in her village and her piglets are good quality piglets. Ni Ketut is really happy with the result. The profit was used to make payments and also for saving.

Ni Ketut and the member of Sari Karya group are really thankful because they still get trusted to receive the loans. They get the same loan size with 14 members. The loan is to increase the pig business.

Ni Ketut has a sow. The loan received is to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage. She hopes the piglets can grow fast and she plans to sell them after two months.

One member couldn’t attend the meeting because of illness. Her loan is responsible by the head of the group.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed and renovate the cage.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from two businesses; general store and selling motorcycle parts. Teresita is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Jose Refugio

texts.en:
Jose Refugio is 46 years old; he is divorced but pays for school and child support to his former wife. 

He owns a grocery store in which he sells different products. He is asking for a loan to buy dairy products and other items for his store. His biggest accomplishment is maintaining and growing his business, and his goal is to transform it into a convenience store with many different products. 

He considers himself credit worthy and likes to pay his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy dairy products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ma. Juvy

texts.en:
Ma. Juvy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Ma. Juvy has been in this business for 3 years. Ma. Juvy earns additional income from selling ready to wear products.

Ma. Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Adailey's Group

texts.en:
Adailey's Group is formed by 6 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Adailey, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Adailey has been a farmer for 6 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Adailey isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program earlier in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Adailey will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Adailey's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
The Marga Damai Group continue their loans after they have succeeded in making the repayments. All of them have one to three sows. The group is a special group, which sells superior piglets only. They give a guarantee on the quality of their piglets.

Ni Ketut has three sows and now she has twelve piglets in her pen. Last loan, she sold fifteen superior piglets. She’s used the profit for savings and to fulfill her family's daily needs. Ni Ketut sells her sows after the sow gives birth more than five times. It’s to keep up the quality of the piglets. She will buy a new young sow again. 

Ni Ketut has become an example to the other members. Now with this new loan, she will purchase superior feed and renovate the pens. She has a plan to build more pens to accommodate the new piglets. 

This group will still need loan support from lenders, Kiva and Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) until they have enough savings to use as capital and to continue the effort by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the pens

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
The Gayatri Indah makes payments on time. The meeting was only attended by a few members of the group and the Treasurer. The head of the group could not attend the meeting because she had to go to Java to pray in the Temple there. All the repayment process can be handled well by Sri, treasurer of the group.

Sri succeeded in maintaining four pigs and she has sold them all. With a satisfactory profit, she has a plan to borrow a new loan again. Now the price for one superior piglet ranges from 500,000 to 650,000 IDR each. Sri has 2,000,000 IDR in the new loan and she will use it to purchase five superior piglets at 500,000 IDR each. She will purchase the feed with her own money taken from the profit from the last loan. Now Sri and also all the members of Gayatri Indah group must wisely manage the business because the price for oil is increasing and it was followed by a rise in prices of daily necessities. Sri will use all the profit to support her children's education and save for the holiday approaching.

loans.use: to purchase five superior piglets.

loans.name: Mujeres De Arena Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Mujeres de Arena, lo integran tres socias emprendedoras, está coordinado por la señora Lillian, quien tiene la edad de 20 años, acompañada y madre de un hijo, es propietaria de una pequeña tienda de ropa ubicada en su domicilio con dos años de experiencia y solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas de ropa, talladores, trajes de niños (as), blúmeres, juegos de brazier, toallas etc., es el primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de la institución ADIM. Otra de las integrantes es la señora Teresa, quien tiene la edad de 56 años y se dedica a la venta de comida su domicilio, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace tres años y la señora Fanny de 23 de edad se dedica a la venta de perfumes Avon y venta de comida desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Arena solidarity group includes three entrepreneurial members.  It’s coordinated by Lillian, who is 20 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of one child.  She is the owner of a small clothing store located in her home.  She has two years of experience and is asking for a loan to buy packets of clothing, bras, children’s outfits, underwear, bra sets, towels, etc.  

This is the first time they are asking for a loan from ADIM.  Other group members are Teresa, who is 56 years old, and Fanny, who is 23.  Teresa works selling food from her home.  She has been in that business for three years.  Fanny has worked selling Avon perfumes and food for two years.

loans.use: to buy packets of clothing, bras, children's outfits, underwear, bra sets, towels, etc., with the goal of increasing earnings.

loans.name: Phala

texts.en:
Phala, 32, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children in total. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for more than ten years. She is able to make an income of USD $5.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to buy sugarcane and resell it. Therefore, Phala would like to apply for a Kiva loan and she will use this loan as the capital investment for her business with sugarcane. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standard. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane to resell

loans.name: Brett

texts.en:
Brett is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Brett is 25 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Brett has a flower vending business in the Philippines. Brett requested a loan of 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more flowers to sell to her customers.

Brett has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Brett would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 44 years old and has four children. Marissa is married and all of her children are in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Marissa has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorelie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lorelie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Lorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel is 22 years old and married with a kid.

Rizel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rizel has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rizel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sulfecia

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Sulfecia works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming peanuts. 

Sulfecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) and, more recently, through Kiva. Sulfecia is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, toys, decorations, and school supplies.

Marilyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, toys, decorations, and school supplies.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhzul, 48 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been selling meat since 2013. 

As their retirement ages are coming near, they wanted to run a private business which will provide for their needs in their retirement. Currently she works as a nurse at a hospital and has served for 16 years. Her husband is a serviceman and works at a trade center. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a large amount of meat at wholesale prices, which will protect her business from an inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of meat

loans.name: Bunpheary

texts.en:
Bunpheary is a farmer from Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is 28 years old, a lovely mother of two single children. She is in the agricultural business, primarily growing rice to earn a living for the family. So far, she has been in this business for fourteen years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2.00 a day.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy construction materials to renovate her house. 

She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home renovation

loans.name: Otgonmunkh

texts.en:
Otgonmunkh, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting and selling planks since 2006. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of house chores and children. 

Otgonmunkh is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to run a cafe by buying necessary equipment and hiring employees. If this business succeeds, he is confident that he can meet his growing children's needs and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to run a cafeteria

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Julia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar por el bienestar de su familia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas ella se desplaza a la ciudad de Manta lugar en el cual compra el mejor pescado para después llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad y sitios aledaños en los cuales tiene mucha clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00 y lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana muy buenos ingresos. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para sus ventas diarias. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para salir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The 24th of December credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  It is famous for its woven straw hats.

Julia lives in this place.  She is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children from her marriage, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Julia is a woman who has always liked to work for the wellbeing of her family.  She works buying and selling fish.  Each morning she heads out of the city of Manta where she buys the best fish in order to take it to sell throughout the entire city, as well as nearby areas where she has many customers.  She works each day from 5:00 a.m. until 3 p.m.  She has been doing this for more than 15 years, and she earns a good income from it.

This loan is to buy fish for her daily sales.  She is a founding member of the credit group and she likes the help that she gets along with the loans.  Her dream is to buy a car in order to go out and sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a hard working man residing in Dulag, Leyte. He is forty-eight years old and runs a small store selling merchandise like eggs, canned goods, spices, ladies bags and accessories, tie wire and other household utensils. He has been operating in this kind of business for more than 10 years. 

Reynaldo has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase materials like wood, nails, and galvanized iron for restoring his store, and assorted stock to sell. These tools will create improvement in his livelihood and also improve his daily earnings.

Reynaldo is hoping  to expand his business to become a successful entrepreneur someday and hopefully provide him with a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, nails, and galvanized iron for restoring his store, and assorted stock to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her child and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Milagros also operates a utility vehicle for transportation service and she wishes to add more units to increase her profit. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Francelina

texts.en: Francelina lives in Baucau, is married and has five children. She has been involved in business activities since 2004. She started with her own working capital of $500. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her future income. She is requesting a loan of $1500 because she has a kiosk and she is very interested in her business, so she will take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goods such as sugar, coffee, eggs, sardines, noodles, milk, biscuits, shampoo, cigarettes, candies, detergent, slippers and other things to sell Including hard drinks.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, eggs, sardines, noodles, milk, biscuits, shampoo, cigarettes, candies, detergent, slippers and other things to sell Including hard drinks.

loans.name: Luke's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Luke, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 62 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and has 4 children.

Luke is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Luke says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Luke will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is a mother from Dulag, Leyte. She is forty-one years old, married, and has eight children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 6. 

She engages in making and selling tuba (coconut) wine. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this kind of business for 10 years now. She also raises and sells hogs as supplemental income to cover the family's expenses. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tuba ingredients like coconut fresh white sap, tungog (red colorant), containers for storage, and purchasing additional pigs and pig feed. If Rebecca could maximize all these tools, that definitely would help improve their livelihood, and also create a higher yield so that she may able to provide for the family's basic needs including the education of her children.

Rebecca would like to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy tuba (coconut wine) ingredients and containers, and purchase additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Thanh Yen 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is a Thai lady who is 34 years old and the mom of two girls, ages of 18 and 15. She lives with her husband and her children in a new Thai traditional house in a small village, and works at cultivation to provide for her family while her husband works for the construction employers. They also raise pigs, chickens, and ducks to have extra income and cover their living expenses. 

To have enough capital to expand their agricultural production, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. She was successful in raising pigs with previous loan, so this time she will continue using the loan to buy piglets and food for the pigs. 

Mrs. Loan hopes that with the financial support as well as the counseling and training from the Program, she will continue gaining a high profit from her investment and will be able to cover educational costs for both of her daughters, because the older the kids are, the more expensive the educational costs will be. 

In the picture, she stands at the second from the left.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is married, and she has 3 children. She has a very high interest in doing business, and she has been involved in business activities since 2011 with her own working capital of $1000, which she has done her best with. 

She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her management of her business, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including books, cooking oils, sauces, SGM milk formula, noodles, sardines, milk, biscuits, slippers and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin so she can have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy books, cooking oils, sauces, SGM milk formula,  noodles, sardines, milk, biscuits, slippers and other things to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell through her business.

Carmen has been in this business for 5 years and also earns income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en: Jenita is 38 years old and a mother of seven children. They are presently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. To have an additional source of income, Jenita has been engaged in reselling processed foods within her community. She aims to strengthen this business in order to gain a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail an additional loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more stocks of tokwa (tofu), imbutido (sausages), home-made vinegar and dried fish to resell. Through this financial assistance, Jenita believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tokwa (tofu), imbutido (sausages), home-made vinegar and dried fish to resell.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija que es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 13 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María es un gran ama de casa que a mas de dedicarse al hogar también se  dedica a la venta de pescado, ella recorre la ciudad vendiendo el pescado cuatro días a la semana, desde muy temprano se desplaza hasta las playas de  Manta lugar en el cual desembarcan muchos barcos, allí ella se surte de pescado fresco para luego ir a vender en su ciudad. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se  gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar  pescado.  Está en el Grupo de Crédito  8 años  y le gusta por los beneficios como la atención médica que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un local donde poder vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The 24th of December credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  It is famous for its woven straw hats.

This is where María lives.  She is 57 years old.  She is married; her husband is a construction worker. From her marriage she has five adult children.  One daughter lives with her; she is a single mother and lives with her two children, ages 9 and 13, who are students in the local schools.

María is a great housewife who, in addition to working in the home, also works selling fish.  She goes throughout the city selling fish four days per week.  She heads for the Manta beaches very early, where many boats come in to disembark.  There she stocks up on fresh fish to later go to sell in the city.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years; it is how she earns money for the good of her family.  This loan is to buy fish.  She has been in the credit group for eight years, and she likes it because of the benefits such as the medical assistance the institution offers.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Vann, 51, is the mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support four children, two of whom are in school and the other two are in university. To support her living, she grows rice as her single source of income. 

For Vann, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In the group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family living in a better condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland.

loans.name: Kimlean

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Kimlean is 36 years old and the mother of four children. To improve her living, she grows cassava on a two and one-half hectares area as her single source of income. 

For Kimlean, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to rent more land and pay a plowing fee to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To rent more land and pay a plowing fee to support her farmland.

loans.name: He Muong 2 Group

texts.en:
Hien is 24 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and her kids in a small Thai traditional house and works at agricultural production to provide for the whole family.

Cultivating rice is the most important production of her family but the income generated from rice is not enough to cover all of their living expenses, especially when her children are so small. Thus, Hien and her husband diversify their production into planting cassava and breeding pigs, chickens, and fish, which actually has helped significantly to improve the family’s income.

To have capital for the investment in cultivation and animal husbandry, Hien has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the third time she has received a loan, and she will use it to buy young fish. She said that the high profit gained from the previous loan motivated her to continue using the loan for fish farming. 

Hien hopes that her investment will go smoothly so that she can provide better for her family, especially for her children. She dreams that they will have a bright future with an abundant life. In the picture, she wears an orange shirt and stands on the far right.

loans.use: to buy young fish

loans.name: Yoeurng

texts.en:
Yoeurng, 32 years old, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in business of selling fish since 2000. On average, she can make an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband, Khun, 35, is a construction worker with a daily salary of USD 10.00. 

Yoeurng would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and she is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. With the support from this loan, she hopes it will help to improve her living standard. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Nilda is into a retail business. She sells rice and fertilizer on a retail and bulk basis to the people in her community. She has been in this kind of business for 5 years now. She is married and has five children. Three of them are still attending school.

Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. Nilda has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy four sacks of rice and fertilizers. She can now take care of the needs of her customers on time and increase her earnings.

In the future, Nilda is hoping that her business will be productive and hopefully will expand for the welfare of her family as well.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice and fertilizers.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a married woman and a mother of six children from Leyte, Philippines. She used to have a small sari-sari or retail store business, but it was ruined after Typhoon Haiyan hit the country a year ago.

Monina wants to start her business again. As of now, Monina is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and other items. This loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Monina hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and other items.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 and married, has three children, and resides in Anastacio, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a motorcycle driver carrying passengers and baggage, while she earns income from food vending. She also has a farm, their main source of income. 

She took a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. Her previous loan, used for her transportation business, has been repaid successfully. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family and it motivates her to work hard in hopes of increasing her returns.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides..

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. El marido es obrero. 
Doña Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible para ganar algo por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en el cual vende frutas y legumbres en las mañanas, en las tardes y noches ella vende comidas rápidas en su local que está  cerca de la universidad local, vende hamburguesas, hot dog, sodas y jugos de frutas. Gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio, el cual le deja muy buenos beneficios que siempre los utiliza para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 5años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The 24th of December credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  It is famous for its woven straw hats.

This is where Gloria lives.  She is 33 years old and is in a common-law relationship, from which she has a six-year-old son who is a school student.  Her partner is a laborer.

Gloria is a very hardworking woman who does what she can to earn something for the good of her family.  She works in retail; she has a shop where she sells fruits and vegetables in the morning.  In the afternoon and at night she sells quick meals in her shop, which is near the local university.  She sells hamburgers, hot dogs, sodas, and fruit juices.  She began this business thanks to her loans, and it gives her great benefits that she uses to keep improving her quality of life.

This loan is to buy fruits, vegetables, and groceries for preparing meals.  She has been in the credit group for five years, and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to get ahead.  Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and groceries.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, and is being represented by Nancy, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two children. Nancy has been a farmer for five years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Nancy isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012, and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Nancy will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Nancy's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jones' Group

texts.en:
Jones is a 63-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jones has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Jones described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Jones’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a 33-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Catherine has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Catherine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Catherine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Leangsim's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Leangsim is 62 years old and a mother of one child. Nowadays, she grows mango and sells vegetables as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via rice cropping. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Tim's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Tim is 48 years old and a mother of four children. For her living, she earns income to improve her family conditions via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. 

For Tim, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

In a group of four, she is group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her farmland better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed in her variety store. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

At present, she focuses on her piggery and computer shop businesses. She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional feeds for her pigs and also for the maintenance of her computers, which will result in a significant increase of profit. An increase in profit will also result in her businesses to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Alma desires to buy additional computers and she wants a bigger place for her business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her computer units and to buy feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 24 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana. Ella habita al lado de compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir. Sonia es una mujer que se esfuerza por tener lo mejor para su familia, y es por ello que ha estado construyendo su vivienda poco a poco, por lo que desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda y terminar así su sueño de tener un lugar agradable donde vivir con su familia.
texts.en: Sonia, who is 24 years old, is a hard-working woman who earns a living making articles of clothing in a nearby business. She lives with her life companion and their two-year-old son in their own house, for which she feels very happy to be able to have a place to live. Sonia is a woman who strives to have the best for her family, and it is for that reason that she has been building her house little by little, for which she wants to acquire a loan with FUSAI to invest in bricks for the floor, cement, sand, and gravel to add a brick floor to her home and thus completing her dream of having a pleasant place to live with her family.

loans.use: to invest in floor bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to add a brick floor to her home

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 59, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a single mother of one dependent child. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for fourteen years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average. 
 
Him would like to apply for a KIVA loan via HKL, and she is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. She hopes to promote her living standards with the support of this loan. She is thankful for all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mimia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mimia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fresh milk in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mimia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of fresh milk to sell to customers.

Mimia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fresh milk to sell.

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabecca's Group is formed by 7 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Rabecca, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, is married and has 3 children. Rabecca has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hard working individual.

Rabecca isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Rabecca will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Rabecca's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
Lam, 29, is a local villager who lives in Kampong Cham province. To overcome the family’s hardships, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn more income to support the family’s needs. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. For Lam, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
An old man living in Kampong Cham province, Van is 60 years old and a father of three children. Because of his family, he is a farmer who grows rice as the main source of income to support the basic needs of his family. 

Besides his main business, he earns extra income via working for others for a fee. This is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan completely. 

He is leading a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can improve his rice farm better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support his rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marelyn has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha de 31 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar apoyada en su trabajo como empacadora de una empresa cercana, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia muy feliz al lado de sus 3 hijas de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad las que se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo. Martha ha estado construyendo su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy feliz, pero a la vez la liquidez económica no le alcanzo para instalar puertas y ventanas en su vivienda, además desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, es por ello que Martha solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas, ventanas, cemento, arena y grava para instalar puertas y ventanas y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha, who is 31 years old, is an admirable woman who strives to sustain the economy of her household, supported by her work as a packer at a nearby business, a job that she has been doing for 6 years. She is a single mother and lives happily in her own house with her three daughters, ages 15, 12, and 9, who are studying in school with her support. Martha has been building her home, for which she feels very happy, but her economic liquidity doesn't go far enough to install doors and windows in her house all at once. In addition, she wants to cement the floor of her house. It is for this that Martha is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in doors, windows, cement, sand, and gravel in order to install doors and windows and cement the floor of her home.

loans.use: to invest in doors, windows, cement, sand, and gravel in order to install doors and windows and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 22 years old and single. Having no other source of income, she operates their motorcycle transport within their community to help her parents in gaining income. She dreams to become successful and financially stable in the future. To attain her goal, she needs to earn and save more income to make an investment someday. 

Due to financial hardship, Rosemarie wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Having this financial assistance, Rosemarie believes that she will continue to operate her motorcycle and hoping that she will earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Heap

texts.en:
Heap is 36 years old and lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved with an agricultural business, primarily growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers, since 1989. On average, she can make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

For supplementary income, she wants to raise cows to re-sell when they are big enough. Because there is not enough money, she is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy cows. 

She hopes that the support from this loan will help her to increase her income. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 68 años de edad es una mujer que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer humilde que habita en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz de tener su casa donde poder descansar. Reyna ha instalado la energía eléctrica de su hogar, pero no tuvo la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar una buena instalación por lo que tuvo que realizar una temporal, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: caja térmica, cable eléctrico, interruptores y tomacorriente para realizar una instalación permanente en su vivienda, evitar así que pueda ocurrir cualquier accidente por tener una instalación inadecuada.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 68, is a woman who works hard in order to take care of the finances of her household.  She provides domestic services in private homes, and it is thanks to this that she has managed to get her family ahead.  She is a humble woman who lives in her own home.  She is very happy to have her own house where she can rest.  

Reyna has installed electricity in her home, but she didn’t have the necessary financial means to do a proper installation, so she had to do it temporarily.  Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in an insulated box, electric wiring, switches, and outlet boxes in order to complete the permanent installation in her house.  In this way she can avoid any accident that might happen due to a faulty installation.

loans.use: to invest in an insulated box, electric wiring, power switches, and outlets in order to complete the permanent installation of electricity in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so that he can travel to his job.

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
Jurinda is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she will sell at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jurinda dreams of having a grocery store, and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat, 59, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has five dependent children in total; one is single and lives under his support, while the other four are married and live independently. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small plot farmland that is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he can generate earnings of USD 5.00 per day.

The current farmland that he owns is small, and it can provide less benefit to him. Samat wants to enlarge his farmland area, but he can’t afford it. Therefore, now he would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. 

He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living condition. He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Nena works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ma. Nena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ma. Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc.

Angelina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. 

Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, se encuentra sin capital para mantener su negocio con vida, eso hace que se decida por un  nuevo préstamo para comprar telas, zippers, dedales, agujas, hilos, botones, etc., para elaborar las prendas de vestir que le han encargado sus clientes así como también para vender.
Con el crédito anterior ha podido trabajar todo este tiempo, su situación económica mejoro un poco, adquirió electrodomésticos para el hogar y cubrió el pago de la deuda.
texts.en:
Martha lacks capital to keep her business going. This has made her decide on a new loan to buy fabric, zippers, thimbles, needles, threads, buttons, etc., to make the articles of clothing that her customers have ordered, as well as items to sell.

With the previous loan, she was able to work all this time. Her economic situation improved a little. She acquired electrical appliances for her home and covered the payments on the debt.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thimbles, needles, thread, buttons, etc., to make the articles of clothing that her customers have ordered as well as items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro lives with his family in a small farm, where he dedicates himself to raising sheep. He also cultivates corn and kidney beans for his family's own consumption. Isidro decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of his animals' manure and to save money on his operating costs. 

Prior to his acquisition, his wife used to walk hours to collect wood, with which they cooked and heated water in the house. In addition to being a time-consuming activity, inhaling smoke while cooking was damaging his wife's health and making her cough. From now on, Isidro will input his sheep's waste into the biodigester, letting the natural methanisation process and bacteria transform it into biogas for his house and a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer for his crops. He will therefore be able to displace the expensive and contaminating LP gas and chemical fertilizers, generating savings and allowing him to pay for his children's school fees and keep them in school as long as possible. 

The biodigester will be used as a natural waste treatment system, reducing Isidro's carbon footprint and making his farm a more comfortable place to live.

This loan represents 16% of the cost of the biodigester, the remaining amount is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a Mexican farmer who owns several animals and also seeds chard, carrots and onions for his family's own consumption. 

The main reasons for which he decided to invest in a biodigester were the savings on operating expenses this acquisition will represent, as well as the protection of the environment. Indeed, by inputting his animals' manure in the biodigester, he will be able to produce his own biogas to cook and heat water, as well as biofertilizer. This will give him the opportunity to displace the expensive fossil fuel (LP gas) and chemical fertilizers he used to rely on by producing renewable energy and organic, nutrient-rich fertilizer for his garden. His animals' waste will not contaminate watersheds anymore, nor attract flies. 

The overall quality of life on his farm will improve and the savings will allow Andres to buy more animals and expand his house to give more space to his children.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the rest being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home (building a kitchen), to buy construction materials like cement, sand, blocks and iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for surgery and medical treatment on her arms.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn, 63, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a lovely mother of three married children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing cassava and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for thirty five years. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.  

Now it is time for her to harvest her cassava. To insure the harvesting acceleration, she would have some people to assist her in the harvesting process yet she doesn't have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for hiring laborers. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Esperanza dreams of having a grocery store, and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. She prays for a victorious life for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 42-year-old married woman who has two children, ages 5 and 2 years-old. She hails from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in raising and selling hogs. Aside from that, she runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, seasonings, noodles, soap and canned goods. She has been engaged in that kind of business for almost five months. Due to a very limited source of income, Magdalina has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy assorted goods for the store and an additional two pigs. These are essential tools in helping bring her livelihood back to life again. 

In the near future, Magdalina is trying her best to manage well all the resources that will eventually lead to a sustainable livelihood as well as in preparation for the education of her children soon.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for her store and an additional two pigs

loans.name: Lilia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Lilia Elizabeth sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more business more if you will lend her an amount of 45,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase in sales will also result to a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Lilia Elizabeth dreams that her store will improve and become more stable. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Ailyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She plans to use her profits to build the business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 54 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonia has been farming vegetables for 11 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sokleang's Group

texts.en:
Sokleang is 31 years old and living in Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are too young. She is a farmer who does rice cropping on a one-hectare area as her main business, and also works for others for a fee as a supplementary source of income. 

This is Sokleang’s second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two she is a leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Sreyleak is 24 years old and a mother of one. She earns income to improve her living conditions via cassava growing. Moreover, she grows rice to earn extra income. She has been involved in her businesses for some years, and earns about 29,800 KHR per day. 

This is Sreyleak's first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund as she leads a group of two. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. Sreyleak hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Im, 50, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of five children. She secures the needs in her family via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in the business for ages and earns about 35,900 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for Im with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan. 

In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for classes and degree costs in industrial engineering for her son

loans.name: Sattra

texts.en:
Sattra, 31 years old, is living in a community of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business in a small farmland which is located near her house. She has been a farmer for more than ten years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 per day.

Sattra wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en:
Emalinda is a hardworking woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two grown up children. Emalinda used to raise pigs but she had to stop when a super typhoon hit her place and ruined everything.

As of now, Emalinda has started to rebuild again. She wants to start her hog raising business again. She is now requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed. This will help her improve her business as well as her income.

Emalinda hopes of improving her way of living and to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a 19-year-old mother who has three children. Having no stable job is difficult for them to sustain the necessities of their family. For this reason, Maricel has been engaged in buying and reselling coconuts to help her husband gain income. She wants to improve this business in order to earn a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to request an additional PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of coconuts and bananas to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts and bananas to resell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and has been helping her husband in operating their own farm, raising vegetables to sell. They also had corn production as their main source of income. 

Her previous loan, used for buying farm products for sale, was repaid successfully.  Her income was used for improving their house. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients for a more productive farm. She wants to expand her farm so as to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients for a more productive farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is gratetful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. 

Susan dreams of having a grocery store and aims to give her three children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Sokky's Group

texts.en: A mother of five dependent children living in Battambang province, Sokky is 48 years old. She earns income to improve her family condition via rice cropping on four hectares area and fish-catching. Now, she can earn income of about 27,800 KHR per day. For Sokky, this is her eighth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Ainy's Group

texts.en:
