A young mother of young child living in Kampong Cham province, Ainy is 18 years old. 

She earns income to support her family’s condition via cassava growing and working for others for a fee. She can earn income of about 29,800 KHR per day. 

For Ainy, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment and special food for her sister.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is into the food vending business. She offers a menu such as chicken and vegetables. Aside from that, she also offers street foods during the afternoon. On the other hand, her husband is a security guard and is a tricycle operator during his day off. 

With Analyn’s goal to improve her store/stall, she wants to access a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 40,000. She is very positive that with the amount, she will earn more and eventually will renovate the store. She plans to purchase more raw materials for her business, such as chicken and vegetables.

Analyn’s dream for the future is to have their own house, for they are currently renting an apartment. Aside from that, she has high hopes that her children will finish their college education.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business, such as chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy spare parts, accessories and maintenance for her tricycle which her husband drives. Through the earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use for the continuous maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and thus steady income. She also sells snacks as additional income. Her tricycle earnings are a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Hermenia dreams of having another tricycle unit and a food stall of her own. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Seangheng's Group

texts.en: Seangheng, a mother of four children, is 50 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. For her living, she grows rice on one hectare area and climbs the palm tree to earn extra income. For Seangheng, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy bamboo to make a ladder to support her palm tree climbing. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family condition.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make a ladder to support her palm tree climbing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put an addition on his home that will be used to sell tamales and allow him to earn extra money with his wife's help while he drives a taxi

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
La socia Rosmery  continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  ladrillos, cementos y bloquetas,la socia vende a sus clientes  que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosmeri continues with her business selling construction supplies. She has had this business for years and it is going well thanks to the efforts she puts into her business every day. She sells bricks, cement and cement blocks to customers who seek out her business. Rosmeri wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. She seeks a loan to buy cement and other materials. She is thankful for the awarded loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Vanna is 45 years old and a mother of five children. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows cassava for resale. 

This is Vanna’s ninth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. 

She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his roof by purchasing zinc and wooden battens, and by paying for workers.

loans.name: Altynai

texts.en:
Altynai is a freshman in AUCA's Anthropology Department and this is her story:

“I lost my father and it was difficult to get over it. We rent a house with my mom and two brothers. My mother is a school-teacher and my two siblings are school-children.  Given the circumstances, I tried to help my mother in any way: volunteered, wrote projects, and was involved in different social events at school in order to be a happy and a good daughter. 

I was even able to save 500 USD working as a waitress and PR assistant in the summer; however it’s a small sum to cover my tuition at AUCA. AUCA is well known for its prominent alumni, who are in demand not only in Kyrgyzstan, but in the World.  I was impressed by the values this university preserves compared to others and also the reputation it has as a corruption-free university with highly developed student body. I did the first step and it was successful, hope dies last.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 26, lives with family members in a rural village of Battambang province. She secures the basic needs in her family via selling grocery items and working for others for a fee. This is the eighth cycle for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In the group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anaximandro

texts.es:
Anaximandro tiene 64 años de edad, vive solo, dedicado al cultivo de café y trabajos de carpinteria, en el caserio de san Gerardo de Churcas, en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Anaximandro se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace 8 años, en el caserio san Gerardo de Churcas. El destino del crédito será para comprar de abonos y para el mantenimiento de su finca. Manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos, pues él posee conocimientos en el cultivo de café. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anaximandro, age 64, lives alone.  He grows coffee and does carpentry work in the San Gerardo de Churcas neighborhood in the Colasay district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  His community devotes itself basically to agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

Anaximandro has been growing coffee in the San Gerardo de Churcas neighborhood for eight years.  The loan will be to buy fertilizers and to perform maintenance on his farm.  By maintaining his farm he will get greater yield.  He has knowledge about growing coffee.  This will allow him, in the short term, to improve his income, increase his profits, and, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to perform maintenance on his farm.

loans.name: Jomelita

texts.en:
Jomelita is a  flower vendor. She sells baby's breath, roses, sunflowers and chrysanthemums. She hails from Dulag, Leyte. She and her husband have seven children. Her youngest child is three. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years. She is in need of financial assistance to continue her existing livelihood.

Jomelita  has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy assorted flowers, fertilizers and medicine. Because of these materials, she could increase the volume of her stock and cater for a bigger circle of buyers, thus providing her family with basic needs. 

Jomelita  would like to expand her business to be successful and also to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy assorted flowers, fertilizers and medicine

loans.name: Sreynat

texts.en:
A resident living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sreynat is 27 years old and the mother of a young child. She secures the needs of her family by selling porridge and other food.

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy ingredients to make food and porridge. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make porridge and other food to sell

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 membres fait parti du Banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. c'est un groupe composé de membres très solidaires et qui s'activent la plupart dans le commerce.
Diouma, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce de légumes et de pains. Elle fait cette activité depuis qu'elle a intégré le banc villageois. 
Elle va acheter du gombo, du niébé et des oignons pour une valeur de 25000 F. Avec ce qui lui reste d'argent, elle va acheter du pain à la boulangerie de la ville qu'elle va revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Les bénéfices récoltés vont lui permettre d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 24 members is part of the Banc villageois which was created on June 4, 2011. It's a group composed of tight-knit members, most of whom work in commerce. 

Diouma, standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children, two of them sons. Her principal activity is selling vegetables and bread. She has been in this business since she became a member of the banc villageois. 

She plans to buy okra, niébé (cowpeas) and onions for 25,000 francs. With the money she has left over, she will buy bread at the town bakery and resell it in the weekly market fairs. 

The profit earned will allow her to help her husband cover their daily expenses and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and bread for resale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina continua con su negocio de materiales de construcción, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  ladrillos, cementos y bloquetas, la socia vende a sus clientes  que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cementos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Las Hormiguitas communal bank, which is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province and the Cusco department. 

Paulina continues with her construction materials business.  She has been in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She continues selling bricks, cement, and cinder blocks.  She sells to her customers who request her materials.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy cement and other materials.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Battambang province, Yan is 50 years old and the mother of eight children. To support her family condition, she grows rice as her main source of income. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee.

Yan has fully repaid her past loans, and she leads a group of four other members to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia Benedicta pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, el banco es ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al reciclaje, venta de leña, brindado el servicio de taxi, venta de emolientes, crianza de gallinas.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a member of the communal bank Señor de Qoyllority de Chimpahuaylla, which is located in the department of Cusco. She continues to run her grocery shop, where she sells rice, sugar and milk, amongst other products. She sells her goods to all the customers who ask for them, and this is how she provides for her family.

Benedicta is asking for a loan to buy items such as rice and soft drinks. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established terms. The other members work in recycling, selling firewood, providing a taxi service, selling emollients, and raising chickens. The member whose photo is attached to the main photo asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work commitments.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Noong Luong 18 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thinh, 27, is married and has two children: a girl, 12 years old, and a boy, 10 years old. She has lived happily with her husband, her children, and her parents-in-law in a small Thai traditional house. Because her parents-in-law are of advanced age and her children are small, the family's source of income is mostly generated by Thinh and her husband. They mainly work at agricultural production, including cultivating rice, planting vegetables and breeding pigs, chickens and fish. Expanding and diversifying production is the way they deal with instability in agriculture and improve earnings to better cover living expenses for their big family. 

Therefore, Mrs. Thinh usually takes out loans from the Anh Chi Em program to invest in agriculture. This is the fifth time she has received a loan from the program, and she will use it to buy young fish to expand fish farming. She believes that, with the counselling from the program together with her experience in fish farming, she will be successful in her investment. 

Mrs. Thinh dreams that her children will have an abundant life and have a brighter future than her. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish to expand fish farming

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre soltera de 41 anos que se dedica a su negocio de panadería. Apoya a su hijo con sus ingresos de la panadería y espera que el tenga un futuro seguro y brillante. Ella es muy trabajadora y se levanta temprano todos los días para preparar el pan para sus clientes. Margarita solicita el crédito para comprar ingredientes para el pan como manteca, harina, y azúcar. 

Ella esta muy agradecida por el préstamo y ha comprometido pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 41-year-old single mother who works in her bakery business. She supports her son through the income from the bakery, and hopes that he will have a secure and brilliant future. She is very hard-working and gets up early every day to prepare the bread for her customers.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make bread such as butter, flour and sugar. She is very grateful for the loan and has promised to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread such as butter, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Korineza Group

texts.fr:
Mélanie fait partie du groupe Korineza  et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 50 ans. Elle a 5 enfants âgés de 11 à 23 ans dont 6 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, huile de palme, haricot,…) depuis 20 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Mélanie is part of the Korineza group and lives in Gitega. She is a 50-year-old widow who has five children between the ages of 11 and 23. Six of them go to school. 

She has been running a boutique (rice, palm oil, beans...) for 20 years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she would like to increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice and beans that she can resell to earn more.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice and beans that she can resell to earn more.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru:
Парвиз мужчина средних лет, ему 34 года. Он проживает в маленьком районе Яван с женой, двумя сыновьями и дочкой. Сыновяьм по 7 и 6 лет, а дочери 2 годика. Жена Парвиза швея. Сам Парвиз является мастером по ремонту домов, а также занимается торговлей. Недавно он построил в своем районе двухэтажное помещение. На первом этаже он будет заниматься торговлей продуктов, а на втором этаже собирается открыть швейный цех для жены. Раньше его жена предоставляла свои услуги дома, а теперь при поддержке мужа она расширяет свой бизнес. 
Парвиз на сумму кредита собирается купить жене три швейные машинки, так как его жена набирает трех рабочих в свой новый цех. Кредит поможем им осуществить намеченные цели. Парвиз и его жена надеются на этот кредит.
texts.en: Parviz is a middle-age man; he is 34 years old. He lives in a small district of Yavan with his wife, two sons and a daughter. The sons are 7 and 6 years old, and the daughter is 2 years old. Parviz's wife is a seamstress. Parviz is a contractor, specializing in house repairs, and is also involved in sales. He recently built a two-story building in his district. He will be involved in selling food products on the first floor and is planning to open a sewing shop for his wife on the second floor. Previously, his wife provided all of her services at home and now, with the help of her husband, she is expanding her business. Parviz is planning to use the loan amount to purchase three sewing machines for his wife because she is hiring three employees for her new shop. The loan will help them to realize their set goals. Parviz and his wife rely on this loan.

loans.use: to purchase three sewing machines for his wife's new sewing shop

loans.name: Jishoryera Group

texts.fr:
Gérard fait partie du groupe Jishoryera  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans  est marié à Goreth une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 9 mois à 8 ans. 

Il fait le commerce des produits vivriers (bananes, manioc,…) depuis 7 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes et de manioc  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gérard is a member of the Jishoryera group who lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and is married to Goreth, a shopkeeper. Together, they have nine children between the ages of 9 months and 8 years.  

She has been selling food (bananas, cassava…) for seven years. 

This is her first loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and manioc that she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and manioc that she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rea works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling bamboo business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rea is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell to customers.

Rea has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Maralkhan

texts.ru: Маралхан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Сегодня в хозяйстве Маралхан есть 2 коровы, на участке мерою 0,15 Га она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сомов (KGS). Маралхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на который она и купит 2 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят Маралхан увеличить поголовье скота и материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en: Maralkhan successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Today, Maralkhan's business contains 2 cows and 0.15 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes. Her monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). Maralkhan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two cows. The earnings from the loan will allow Maralkhan to increase her livestock headcount and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Dukanure Group

texts.fr:
Immaculée fait partie du groupe Dukanure   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans  est mariée à Joachin, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 8  à 14 ans. 

Elle  fait le commerce de bière locale  depuis 5  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes    à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Immaculée is a member of the Dukanure groups who lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and married to Joachin, a shopkeeper. Together, they have four children between the ages of 8 and 14.

She has been selling local beer for five years. 

This is her first loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas that she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas that she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Chinnary's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Chinnary is 44 years old. She is a mother of three children, of whom two are in school and one in university. 

She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and grocery items selling. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income to support her family. 

For Chinnary, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yields to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
Teo, 45, is a farmer who is living in Banteay Meanchey province and is a mother of five children. Because of her living, she can earn income to improve her family condition via rice cropping on a two hectares area. Moreover, her husband can earn more income via car driving. She can earn an income of about 31,400 KHR per day. 

This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland, bigger than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province, Leang is 48 years old and a mother of three children. She grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement income. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 27,400 KHR per day. 

For Leang, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of three, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sinan is 25 years old and a mother of one kid. For the sake of her family, she grows rice and she can earn more income via making up. She can earn income about 30,600 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland and buy more make up material. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland and buy more make up material.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Файзинисо. Ей 44 года. Она верная жена и мать. Фазинисо с семьей проживает на районе под названием Спитамен. Район находиться на северной территории Республики Таджикистана. Файзинисо 10 лет свой жизни посвятила деятельности скотоводства. Файзинисо также работает в колхозе. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить пару голов мелко рогатых скотин, чтобы увеличить поголовья и тем самым увеличить доходность от бизнеса. Файзинисо заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку. Она верит, что мир не без добрых людей и ей обязательно помогут.
texts.en: The name of the woman on the photograph is Fayziniso. She is 44 years old. She is a loyal wife and mother. Fayziniso and her family live in the Spitamen district. This district is located in the northern part of the Tajikistan Republic. Fayziniso has devoted 10 years of her life to animal husbandry. Fayziniso also works at a collective farm. She is requesting this loan to buy a couple of heads of small livestock in order to increase her headcount and, thus, increase her business profitability. Fayziniso is grateful for the help and support in advance. She believes that the world is not without kind people, who will certainly help her.

loans.use: to buy a couple of heads of small livestock

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 41 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé depuis le 04 juin 2011. Les membres se connaissent et habitent presque le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Adama, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 05 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche ovine. Et avec son crédit elle va  acheter des moutons et les engraisse pour une durée de 04 mois, avant de les revendre le cinquième mois
Avec les bénéfices, elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
This 41-member group is part of the banc villageois that was founded on June 4, 2011. The members know one another and almost all of them live in the same village. Their main activities are business and livestock fattening. 

Adama is the group representative. She is standing at right in the photo with her hand raised. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of eight children (including five boys). 

She fattens sheep. With her loan, she will buy sheep and fatten them for four months. She will then sell them during the fifth month. 

With her earnings, she will support her husband with the daily expenses and bolster her savings.

loans.use: with livestock fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance and fertilize his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Mr Komla vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à KPALIME. Il exerce au même lieu son activité de vente de boissons et se fait aider par sa femme. Son premier prêt lui servira d'acheter des boissons pour répondre aux besoins des clients à l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Il souhaite devenir grossiste et construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Komla lives with his wife and children in Kpalime.

He is in business in this same town; he sells beverages, aided by his wife. His first loan will allow him to purchase beverages to meet customer demand during the holiday season.

He hopes to become a wholesaler and to later to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy liquors and soft-drink cans.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and a pig-raising enterprise. Analiza is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 43 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 4 года назад стала заниматься торговлей товарами широкого потребления. Также она занимается полеводством на участке мерою 2,0 ГА, выращивая клевер и занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Динары есть 6 коров, 60 овец и 4 лошади. У Динары в обороте есть товары на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS), в основном продукты питания и одежда. Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 149,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку товаров под реализацию. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также на постройку жилого дома.
texts.en: Dinara is 43 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in selling consumer goods 4 years ago. She is also involved in farming on 2.0 hectares of land, growing clover, and involved in animal husbandry. Dinara's business has 6 cows, 60 sheep and 4 horses. Dinara has a capital of 300,000 som (KGS), consisting primarily of food products and clothing. Dinara requested a loan in the amount of 149,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy goods for resale. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and also to build a house.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale in order to expand her selection and attract new customers

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Channa is 25 years old and a father of a young child. He earns money to support his family by rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. He has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 25,000 KHR per day. This is his first loan with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). In a group of five members, he is the leader. He will spend his portion of the loan to buy a water filter. He hopes that he can improve his family's condition so they have enough clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo de 52 años vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 16 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 52 and lives with his wife and their two children. For 16 years he has run a bakery from his own home. He has a lot of customers due to the quality of his bread. He uses the profits to cover his household costs successfully.

Ricardo is asking for a loan to buy items such as flour, sugar, flavoured jellies and moulds. This will help him carry on with his work and thus obtain a better income for an improved qualify of life.

loans.use: to buy items such as flour, sugar, flavoured jellies and moulds.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Le BV est composé de membres très solidaires et qui s'activent la plupart dans le commerce.
Fatou est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce, activité qu'elle pratique depuis qu'elle a intégrée le BV. Elle a ouvert une échoppe chez elle qu'elle gère. Elle va acheter 02 sacs de sucre à 27500 F l'unité; 04 bidons d'huile de 20 L à 15000 F l'un, 10 sacs de riz à 15000 F l'unité. Les 35000 F qui lui reste seront utiliser comme fonds de roulement et à payer le transport. Les produits ainsi acheter seront revendus en détail.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the village finance association created on June 4, 2011. The association is composed of supportive members, most of whom are in the retail business.

Fatou is 49 years old. She is married and mother to one boy. Her main business is retail, an activity she has practiced since joining the association. She has opened a shop in her house and manages it. She will purchase two bags of sugar costing 27,500 F each, 4 twenty-liter containers of oil at 15,000 F each, ten bags of rice costing 15,000 F each. The remaining 35,000 F will be used as working capital and to pay for transportation. She will retail the product thus purchased.

Profits will allow her to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and millet.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino tiene 68 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Cristino vive con su cónyugue y sus hijos, en el distrito de Sallique, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Dicho distrito es mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.

Cristino se dedica a la venta de comida, cuenta con un puesto de venta de comida ubicado en el interior del mercado de abastos de Sallique, en el cual ya tiene más de 04 años en dicho puesto el cual es propio. pero Cristino tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio de venta de comida ya que anteriormente vendía cerca al mercado de Sallique, pero cuando remodelaron el mercado se le otorgó un puesto en el interior del mercado, por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro, además Cristino se dedica a la agricultura en su caserío, y él cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y económicas. El destino del crédito será para invirtirlo en su negocio comprando cantidades mayores de materia prima para poder aumentar su producción y asi cumplir con toda la demanda insatisfeca y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristino is 68 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. Cristino lives with his wife and children in Sallique district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people of this area primarily farm rice and have local businesses. This district is medium-sized with aspirations to grow.

Cristino sells food. He has had a his own food stand for 4 years in the inside section of the Sallique market. Cristino has more than 10 years of experience in the food business as previously he sold near the Sallique market, but when they remodeled the market he was awarded a stand inside the market. So he has a lot of experience in his field. In addition, Cristino has some crops on his land. He has very good personal, work and credit references. The loan will be used to invest in his business buying large quantities of ingredients to be able to increase his production and in this way meet the customer demand and be able to acquire an acceptable utility service in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying large quantities of ingredients so he will be able to increase his production.

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Savon is 32 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family by selling grocery items and rice cropping. She can earn an income of about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Savan, this is her first loan with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She is leading a group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, a local resident from Kampong Speu province, is 27 years old and a mother of two children; she does rice cropping as a single source of income to support her family. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. For Mom, this is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). In a group of seven members, she is the leader. She will spend her portion of the loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that her house has enough clean water to use, as other houses do.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 23 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans la bonne entente. Les membres habitent le même village et les environs. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Marème, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle compte investir dans l'embouche ovine et le petit commerce. Elle fait ces activités depuis bien longtemps et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle va acheter un mouton entre 40000 et 45000 F. Elle achète des aliments pour bétail et paie les frais vétérinaires, le tout à 20000 F. Elle compte le revendre à 70000 F ou 75000 selon le flux du marché au bout de de 05 mois. En parallèle, elle souhaite faire du commerce . Elle va acheter: des oignons, bouillons, poissons séchés pour une valeur de 5000 F qu'elle va revendre dans son village. Avec cette dernière activité, elle réalise un bénéfice tournant aux alentours de 500 à 1000 F. Elle refait ce processus a chaque fois que son stock s'épuise. Cette activité lui permet de payer ses intérêts, de renforcer son épargne et aussi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de renforcer son épargne et payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This 23-member group belongs to the local financing association which was created on June 7, 2011. It is composed of tightly-knit members. The members live in one village and its neighboring area. Most of them are in retail or animal husbandry.

Marème, who is standing to the right and raising her hand in the picture, is 47 years old. She is married and a mother of five; two of the children are boys. She plans on investing in sheep husbandry and retail. She has been in these businesses for a long time and has a good amount of experience in them.

She will purchase one sheep between 40,000 and 45,000 F. She will also purchase animal feed and pay veterinary expenses, estimated in total at 20,000 F. She plans on reselling the sheep for 70,000 to 75,000 F, depending on where the market is after five months. In parallel, she wants to have a retail activity. She will purchase onions, bouillon cubes, and dried fish—for a total cost of 5,000 F—which she will resell in her village. With this second activity, she will make a profit between 500 and 1,000 F. She goes through this process every time her stock runs out. It allows her to pay her interests, to increase her savings, and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to raise sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and some lime.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny, 24, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province. She is a mother of two children; one is in school and one is in university. To earn a living, she does rice cropping, which earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. This is her first loan with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She is leading a group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 23 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans la bonne entente. Les membres habitent le même village et les environs. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Khady, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle compte investir dans l'embouche ovine. Elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le BV et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va acheter une brebis et son agneau à 37500 F les deux. Elle compte les élever et au bout de 05 mois les revendre à 70000 F. Avec les 17500 qui reste de son argent, elle va payer les frais vétérinaires. Les aliments pour bétail c'est elle même qui va les préparer.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This 23-member group belongs to the local financing association which was created on June 7, 2011. It is composed of members who live together harmoniously. The members live in one village and its neighboring area. Most of them are in retail or animal husbandry.

Khady, who is standing to the right and raising her hand in the picture, is 57 years old. She is married and a mother of seven; two of the children are boys. She plans on investing in sheep husbandry. She has been in this business since joining the association and has a good amount of experience in the domain.

She will purchase one ewe and her lamb at 37,500 F for both. She plans on raising them and reselling them for 70,000 after five months. The remaining 17,500 F will be used to pay for veterinary expenses. She will prepare the animal’s feed herself.

Profits will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to raise sheep.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for ten years, and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 25 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Idja Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe formé de 10 femmes battantes exercent dans divers domaine d'activité et cela ce constate sur la photo.Bernadette, membre représentatif vend de la boisson. Son activité est rentable puisqu'elle arrive à face aux dépenses de fonctionnement et à dégager des bénéfices. Elle est marié et mère de sept enfants dont 6 vont à l'école et une de ses fille est mariée. Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter de la boisson stocker pour vendre. Pour ce qui est des remboursements, ce groupe les font à la bonne date. Les bénéfices de ce prêt permettront à Bernadette de continuer son activité et d'aider son époux à faire face à la charge familiale.
texts.en:
This group is made up of ten dynamic women who work in various businesses, as evident from the photo.

Bernadette, the member highlighted today, sells beverages. Her business is profitable, as she manages to pay for her expenses and to turn a profit. She is married and a mother of seven. Six of the children go to school, and one of her daughters is married.

With this loan, she will purchase beverages to stock up and retail. As for paying back, the group has always met deadlines. Profits made possible by this loan will allow Bernadette to carry on business and to help her husband pay for the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on beverages for resale.

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha is a persevering mother who works to help her husband and raise their four children, 2 of whom are already in college.  She manages her sari-sari store, which is located in the public market, and competence and sales are increasing.  She is very thankful that she has been a member of Paglaum for 5 years; she has availed herself of several loans, and pays on time. 

As of now, Marietha has applied for a loan to re-stock her sari-sari store with basic commodities and repair a portion of her store. She prays and hopes that her children finish their studies and get a better job.

loans.use: to re-stock her sari-sari store with basic commodities

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé depuis le 04 juin 2011. Le Banc villageois est composé de membres qui se connaissent et habitent presque le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Astou est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons et les engraisse et au bout de 05 cinq mois les revends dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle compte acheter 10 moutons à 25000 F l'un. Le reste de l'argent va lui servir à acheter de la nourriture pour bétail et à payer les frais vétérinaires. Elle les revendra par la suite à 50000 F l'un.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne. Les frais scolaires et soins des enfants sont aussi à sa charge.
texts.en:
Astou is a member of a Banc Villageois created on June 4, 2011.  The Banc Villageois comprises members who know one another and who, for the most part, live in the same village.  Their main activities are small retail and livestock fattening.

Astou is 33 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children, including three boys.  She is involved in  fattening sheep.  She buys sheep, fattens them for five months before reselling them at weekly markets.  She is planning to buy ten sheep priced at 25,000 francs each.  She will use the rest of the money to buy cattle feed and pay the veterinary expenses.  She will resell her sheep for 50,000 francs each.  Astou uses her profits to help her husband with the daily expenses.  She also takes care of the children's tuition fees and daily needs.

loans.use: to buy and fatten 10 sheep.

loans.name: Jhun

texts.en:
Jhun is 31 years old. He is married with two children. The eldest is currently enrolled as a Grade I pupil and the youngest is in preparatory school. Jhun gets his income through selling agricultural and poultry products. Aside from that, he owns a piggery in Diaat, Maria Aurora. Though an employee of a poultry company, his wife helps him in managing the businesses.

To further improve and earn a higher income Jhun wants to request a loan of PHP 20,000 from Kiva lenders. He will utilize the amount for buying more stocks of poultry feeds and fertilizers. Jhun has been managing the business for six years already and so he has already acquired many loyal customers. Usually he is earning PHP 30,000 a month. Most of his earnings are being used as rolling capital for the businesses and for the education of their children. 

It is Jhun’s dream to be a distributor of agricultural and poultry products in Aurora. He is working hard and very positive that generous Kiva lenders will grant his requested loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of poultry feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is married, and she works hard to support her family.  She has a business making and selling ice candy in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling natural medicines. Warlita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 45.  She is the mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well.  Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others.  Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Parveen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.  She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in positive way.  This amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store business

loans.name: Hildercard's Group

texts.en:
"Hildercard, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Hildercard will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Hildercard plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Hildercard’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is 32 years old. She is a responsible mother of four children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six persons. 

Nabila is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine for her stitching work. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Nabila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. 

Nabila is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her stitching work.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living by engaging in a food vending business. She sells roasted  banana (banana is peeled, placed on a bamboo stick,and then roasted, glazed with margarine and sprinkled with brown sugar). During the night time, she sells barbequed hotdogs as a supplemental income to the family.  She has been in the food vending business for almost 10 years.  She is married and has nine children. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 10 months old. Her husband is a farmer.

Genelyn  has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to  buy additional stock, like mid-ripe bananas, hotdogs and materials for making a barbecue stand, like wood, nails and bamboo. These materials will help her put her operation in good shape again and create higher earnings.

Genelyn is hoping that she will make it more productive.  At the same time, she will continue sending her children to school for bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, like mid-ripe bananas, hotdogs and materials for making barbecue stand like wood, nails and bamboo

loans.name: Blessing

texts.fr: Âgée de 40ans, madame Blessing vit avec son mari et leurs enfants à Lomé. Pour contribuer au bien - être de la famille, elle revend des bals de friperies dans un marché de la ville de Lomé depuis 1996. Elle souhaite devenir grossiste et aider ses enfants à s'épanouir.
texts.en: Blessing is 40 years old, and she lives with her husband and children in Lomé.  In order to contribute to her family's well-being, she has been reselling bales of used clothing at one of the markets, in town, since 1996.  Her goal is to become a wholesaler and to see her children blossom.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Afin d'augmenter son niveau d'activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille, Akossiwa revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle exerce son activité au marché et s'approvisionne au même lieu depuis 2008. Âgée de 21ans, elle a 1 enfant en charge et pour conjoint un revendeur.
texts.en: Akossiwa resells general food products and she is taking a first loan from WAGES in order to reach her goals: to increase her activity level and ensure her family's well-being.  She sells her goods at the market, and she has been purchasing her merchandise from the same place since 2008.  She is 21 years old, she has one child under her care, and her husband is also a reseller.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a responsible mother, who always cares for the best for her six children. To earn a living Perla is involved in livestock while her husband is a farmer.  

Perla joined Paglaum in 2009 and has taken several loans already which she repaid in a timely manner. 

Perla wanted to expand her livestock, so she applied for the amount of 4,000 PHP to buy two additional piglets and two sacks of feed. She has been in this type of work for three years.  

Perla wants to save with Paglaum for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and feed.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Editha works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits. Editha is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock items like pants, curtains, blouses and other clothing.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like pants, curtains, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Gulshan's husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It currently requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Gulshan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Gulshan's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. He will be able to provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income. Gulshan  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Gulshan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's taxi. .

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is age 28.  She is a mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Khalida requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.  Khalida hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.  Khalida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventories for the general store.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 49 years of age and married to a caterer who provides services such as decoration lights and tents for wedding, birthday and engagement ceremonies. Because this is a seasonal business, it is not especially profitable. 

Now that the marriage season is about to peak, Shahnaz has requested a loan for her husband to buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services. Shahnaz thanks Kiva and and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new wedding tents and bamboo for catering services.

loans.name: Ameda

texts.en: Almeda is 53 years old and married.  She has two college-age children.  Her husband is a manual laborer, and the income is not enough to finance their college students.  Almeda has helped her husband from her sari-sari store income for three years and now has expanded her business to salted egg delivery.  Almeda has been a member of Paglaum for four years, with several loans, and she has repaid on time.  Now, Almeda is applying for the amount of 30,000PHP.  One half of the available loan will be used as down payment on a secondhand motorcycle for egg delivery.  The other half amount will be used as starting capital of the salted egg business. Almeda is very happy because of the financial literacy that Paglaum offers to the members.  It is very useful to her in handling and budgeting the income they have to sustain the education of her children.

loans.use: use for down payment of secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Verónica continua con su negocio de venta de ladrillos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar ladrillos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Veronica continues with her business selling bricks. The member has been working in this business for years which has been going well thanks to the effort she puts in to the business each day. The member wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

The member requests the loan to buy bricks. The member is happy for the loan and is committed to fulfilling the payments.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Michilou

texts.en: Lydia is single and has two children.  She operates their own farm, raising vegetables to sell. Her previous loan was used for buying farm products for sale and was repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer and plant more varieties of vegetables.  She should have more sales daily.  She wants to expand her farm so as to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and plant more varieties of vegetables

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
Rosiel sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to purchase additional frozen products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 16,000 PHP. This new loan will go to more stocks of charcoal, additional piglets and fish, a business which she also operates for additional income aside from her frozen products. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more products to sell. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profits.  That will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Rosiel hopes for the every day provision and security for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal and other products needed to increase her retail business.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat, aged 39, is a responsible mother and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste papers, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have a stock of scrap to sell for getting money.
Therefore, Ulfat has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for reselling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 66 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She lives in La Esperanza, Sibutad.  Geronima has busied herself in pig raising for seven years and earns a living for the family.  Her husband is a tenant of a coconut land, and because of their sincerity and honesty in the remittance of the income from that land, the owner offered to sell the said land on an installment basis.  Geronima is very happy to grab the opportunity, and asked the assistance of Paglaum Cooperatives.  They can avail themselves of loans amounting to 30,000PHP, which is used as a down payment on the coconut land they cultivate.  

Geronima has been a member of Paglaum for six years and has taken loans four times, with repayments on time.  Geronima is very thankful to become a member of the Cooperatives because her dreams are now coming to reality.

loans.use: make a down payment on land acquisition

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve, Akossiwa a un enfant en charge. Elle a démarré en 2011 son activité de tissus coupons à domicile. Afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des tissus coupons. Avec le bénéfice qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut ouvrir une boutique et assurer ses propres besoins.
texts.en: Akossiva is a widow and she has one child in her care.  She sells fabrics from home and started her business in 2011.  In order to better satisfy the needs of her customers, she is taking a second loan from WAGES to buy fabrics.  She plans to use her future profits to open a shop and to take care of her own needs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Hoshimjon

texts.en: Hoshimjon was born in 1996. He is hardworking and industrious man. Hoshimjon is a student in the first course at Tajikistan National University. He studies at the faculty of Economy and Finance. Hoshimjon learns economy and the banking system. He is one of the best students. He always helps his classmates. Hoshimjon has a lot of friends. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition to the university. He awaits your support and in advance thanks you for generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase commodities for her store, such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 46 years old, is married and has two children.  She has been selling food and snacks to make a living. She sells food in their village and also accepts orders for any occasion, earning well for the family.  To meet the current demands, she took a new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to cater to the needs of her customers. She was happy to say that with this loan she should meet her desired income and save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to cater to the needs of her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, 59 years old, is married and a resident of Migpangi, Tangub City, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman and they have five children. The fish he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for seven years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market.  Last October 26, 2011 both Myrna and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance that they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 10,500PHP to buy more fish for resale.  With Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is from Barangay 1, Tangub City, Philippines. She is 51 years old, separated, and has one child. Lourdes is engaged in buying and selling green tea products.  Aside from her business, she is also a massage therapist. She has been doing this for five years and it greatly helped her meet her financial needs, especially the education of her daughter, until she graduated. She requested a loan to purchase more stocks of green tea to serve more customers. Expanding her inventories would also mean an increase to her income. Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of green tea to sell

loans.name: Placida

texts.en: Placida is married and has three children.  She has been helping her husband manage their own farm for a living. She has been harvesting and selling rice and she earns well to support their needs. Her previous loan used for farming costs had been repaid successfully.  To improve the farm, she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer for a more productive farm.  She is determined in her work. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for a more productive farm.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en: Davlat was born in 1993. He lives with his family in the capital of Tajikistan. Davlat is the eldest child in his family. His sisters and brother are schoolboy and schoolgirls. Davlat is a student of the second course. He learns the designing of houses. Davlat studies well and he is able to draw wonderful pictures. He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Heliam's Group

texts.en:
"Heliam is 42 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Heliam has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Heliam also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about.

Obtaining this loan means that Heliam's Group will be able to receive a total of 2 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lita is 35 years old and has one child in school.

Lita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Lita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is applying for a loan of $ 1500,   She is married and has six children. Her husband is working in the agriculture office. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including slippers, soaps, biscuits,  noodles, coffee, salts, candles, candies, cooking oils, sugar and other things.  She started her business in 2010 with a working capital of $ 250.00.  She hopes to open a big store in the future. With this loan she can improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy slippers, soaps, biscuits,  noodles, coffee, salts, candles, candies, cooking oils, sugar and other things.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Mean is 59 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she grows rice as a single source of income to support her family condition. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can update her family living in a good health.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat was born in 1965 year. She lives with her family together in the north part of Tajikistan. Nusrat has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes in a local market more than 10 years. She started her own business because she needed money. Nusrat is a careful mother and the main bread winner for three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Nusrat’s daughter helps her with managing the business. Nusrat is a very industrious woman and makes an individual approach to each client. Nusrat is going to buy a new collection of women's clothes for the new winter season. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy new collection of women's clothes for new winter season

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is very grateful for the loan that was previously granted to her. It was a big help for her business as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Evelyn would like to apply for a new 14,000 Philippine peso loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business as well as to pay for the maintenance of her computer unit used for a PisoNet business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and expenditures. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn hopes to buy another PisoNet unit to increase her profit. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business, and to pay for the maintenance of her PisoNet unit.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and married.  She has six children, one of whom is in school.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming sugarcane for six years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kalyskan

texts.ru: Калыскан 53 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. В 1989 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. Калыскан на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 15 овец. На участке мерою 5,0 Га она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Калыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 18 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Калыскан развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Kalyskan is 53 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She started her own animal husbandry business in 1989. Today Kalyskan's business contains 2 cows and 15 sheep. She grows clover for the household consumption on 5.0 hectares of land. Her combined average monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). Kalyskan requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 18 sheep. The earnings from the loan will allow Kalyskan to develop her business and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy 18 sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana has a mango farm in Tangub. This is her primary source of income for her family. Feliciana makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and good income. 

Recently, she needed money to purchase herbicides for growing mangoes and to pay for labor costs for preparing her land. She asked Paglaum MPC for the loan. 

Feliciana wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply mangoes to fruit stands in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides for growing mangoes and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is 49 years old and lives in San Jose Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has five adult children. She has a shop that sells rice from their rice field and has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan for house renovation to make her family more comfortable. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Dina wants to share her blessings with others.

loans.use: with house renovation

location.town: Molave - San Jose Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 57 years old, She is married and has 11 children.  She lives in Garang, Tangub City.  Remedios and her husband earn a living through farming.
