They mastered doing this type of activity when they got married and supported her children's education and their family needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in February 2011. 

She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. Remedios requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have a high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm. This will give her farming income a big boost. Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agri-business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a good crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 24 года, замужем, образование- среднее, воспитывает сына дошкольного возраста. Айнуре родители на свадьбу подарили жеребенка, с него и начался ее сельскохозяйственный бизнес. На  сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров и 5 лошадей. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства Айнуры составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также хочет построить дом.
texts.en: Ainura is 24 years old, married, has a secondary education and raising a school-age son. Ainura's parents gave her a foal as a wedding present, and he was the beginning of her own business. Today her business contains 6 cows and 5 horses. She grows barley for the household consumption and sale on 1.0 hectares of land. Ainura's monthly business profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a horse to increase her livestock headcount. Ainura plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and also wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy another horse in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
An old woman living in Takeo province, Vanny is 62 years old and a mother of two children. She earns income to improve her family conditions via teaching in school and rice cropping. 

Moreover, she can earn extra income via pig raising and it earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. For Vanny, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions in a gradual pace. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelors degree majoring in history. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelors degree, majoring in history.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as meats, vegetables, staple grains, drinks, fruit, etc.,and to make improvements to his food cart.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 59 years old and lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 adult children. She cultivates a corn field and has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan to pay for labor and land preparation for her corn so that she can have a greater harvest to sustain her family's daily needs. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Emma hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and preparation of land.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en: Rosavilla has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this. She raises pigs to sell and is financially prepared for the next cropping season. She  is now planning to take a new loan  to buy two heads of piglets and livestock feed. She is now happy to say that with this investment, she will be able to expand her piggery in the near future.

loans.use: to buy two heads of piglets and livestock feed.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Speu province, Mom is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school while one is too young. She earns income to cover her family's needs via selling grocery items. She can earn about 40,000 KHR in income per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of five to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can make her family's living healthy.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 28-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her two children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Hina is also providing sewing services and earn an income in order to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and it will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Hina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 58 years old, a widow and a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through raising piglets for commercial sale. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of Php 20,000 to buy additional piglets. She wants to double her income to sufficiently support the needs of her family.

Melchora deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for additional piglets for commercial sale

loans.name: Maurice's Group

texts.en:
Maurice is 54 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Maurice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Maurice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Maurice's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nelson Kennedy

texts.es: Nelson de 47 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas una mayor de edad y una pequeña de 3 años de edad. Él siempre pone todo su esmero en su trabajo en una empresa cercana para poder darle lo mejor que este en sus manos a su familia. Como se observa en la fotografía el techo de la vivienda de Nelson se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y evitar así que las lluvias se filtren deteriorando sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Nelson, 47 years old, is a hard-working man who lives in his own home with his life companion and their two daughters, one who is adult and a little one, three years old.   He always takes great pains about his work in a nearby company in order to give the best within his reach to his familly.  

As can be seen in the photograph, the roof of Nelson's home is in poor condition.  Because of this, he has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to buy laminated metal sheets, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home and keep the rains from entering, ruining theier belongings.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood  and nails to replace the roof of his home

loans.name: Mirian Jessica

texts.es:
Mirian Jessica tiene 31 años de edad, es separada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Mirian Jessica se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, entre otros; ella tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Mirian Jessica solicita préstamo para compra de una cantidad mayor de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Mirian Jessica piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian Jessica is 31 years old, separated from her husband, and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotun district, Chiclayo province.  Her community mainly earns a living in agriculure, cattle-raising and business.

Mirian Jessica works at raising and selling animals, such as ducks, roosters, chickens, guinea pigs and others.  She has been working at this business for more than 10 years, and it is located at the back at her home.  Mirian Jessica is asking for a loan to buy a larger number of small animals and birds.  This purchase will allow her to have a greater variety and productivity from the animals, greatly affecting her sales.  Mirian Jessica plans to increase her stock of animals and birds for sale to meet different tastes and needs among her customers in the area.  This will alllow her to increase her income in a short time, improve her earnings and thus the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a large number of small animals  and birds

loans.name: Sanzhar

texts.en:
Sanzhar is a freshman in AUCA's International and Business Law Department and this is his story:

“I am a smart person with a big motivation to study in American University in Central Asia. I have tools to become a successful student. Keeping grades up, taking part in challenging courses and participating in different social clubs are some of them. I also have a goal to make an outstanding career. 

"Entering AUCA was the first step to gain those plans. You ask, why AUCA?  AUCA has prominent professors, who are committed to seeing you succeed and will help you to develop your ideas, knowledge and understanding. The University is located in the center of Bishkek, of beautiful and green city. You never feel lonely with AUCA spirit, which tips you about the classes and clubs to take. 

"The deficiency of money is the biggest and most obstructing problem that doesn’t allow me to begin to embody my goals. Such a disheartening circumstance can be settled by Kiva loan.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Commerçante des amuses gueules faites à base de la farine de blé et de bananes plantains, AKOKO est veuve et âgé de 29 ans et mère de trois enfants, habite le quartier Adidogomé près du marché. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché de bokovi et les revend dans le voisinage de son quartier. AKOKO sollicite un appui financier pour mieux s’approvisionner afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins et prendre soin de sa santé.
texts.en: A merchant selling tasty snacks made of wheat flour and plantains, AKOKO is a widow, 29 years old, and a mother of three, living in the Adidogomé district near the market. She gets her supplies once a month at the Bokovi market and sells her goods in her neighborhood. AKOKO is requesting financial support for more supplies to make more profit, so as to be able to support herself and care for her health.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of wheat flour and 10 bunches of plantains

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 39 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one school-aged child.  

Ricky has an existing flower delivery business with financing from the Paglaum Cooperatives.  As of now, Ricky plans to engage in pig-raising because he wants to maximize the area of his home. 

Ricky is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy materials to improve the pig fence and to buy five additional piglets and feed. Ricky personally manages the delivery of his flowers, and at the same time, takes good care of his piglets after delivery. 

Ricky is very thankful of the opportunity that Paglaum has given to him and hopes that he can offer a job to his neighbour in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the pig fence and to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pure water dans un boutique depuis 1989, Mariama désire un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle ne rencontre aucune difficulté et espère avec le prêt réapprovisionner et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Veuve de 61ans, elle a en charge 06 enfants dont 01 scolarisé.
texts.en: A retailer of “pure water” in a shop since 1989, Mariama would like a second loan to purchase some merchandise. She is encountering no difficulties at all and hopes to stock up again with this loan and to meet the needs of her family. A widow, she is 61 years old and supports six children, of whom one is in school.

loans.use: to purchase pouches of “pure water”.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kossi Grégoire  is a young man, 28 years old, whose wife is a hair stylist. He is the father of two children, aged 5 and 2, who are in school. Kossi Grégoire has a revenue-generating business selling mobile phones. Lacking the funds to bolster his business, he is asking for a second loan to purchase some merchandise. He would like to reinvest and sell in bulk, as well as to meet the needs of his family.

loans.name: Atipay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sara Rossana,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de pinturas,  la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas de oleo entre otros.
  
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de calzados, negocio de venta de libros, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "ATIPAY." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Sara Rossana.  She continues to operate a business selling paint. The member has been running this business for several years. The business has been doing well thanks to the daily dedication that she devotes to the business. She wishes to be able to continue working to be able to support her family. 

The member requests a loan to buy oil paints, among others items.

The other members work in a shoe sales business, a book sales business, a grocery store, and in food sales.

The members who appear in the inset photographs requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons.

The person who appears with the face covered does not belong to the communal bank.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this means, and she commits to complying with her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil paints, among others.

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 53-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Fredrick has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Fredrick described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Fredrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and supplies for her computer units. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her  20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies and maintenance of her computers. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the units are regularly maintained and working.

Liberty wants her house to be renovated in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 24-year-old single man with a diploma certificate, living with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. Ahmmed strives strongly to make a better future for himself. 

He has a piece of land and has a small amount of money. Ahmmed decided to build a small house on that land but his money is not enough. In order to achieve his small business, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and iron steel to build a house.

Ahmmed hopes to get married soon.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a house, such as cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and steel

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Moses will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Moses plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Moses’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy was born in the year 1990. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking and smart woman. 

She works in a pedagogical college as a cleaning-woman. Tursunoy does her job well. Her colleagues know her as a hardworking and honest woman. Her mother also works as a cleaning woman in this college. 

Tursunoy wants to help her mother to treat her eyes. Her mother for some years has suffered from eye-sickness. Tursunoy is asking for a loan of 1,200 TJS to buy medicines for the treatment of her mother’s eyes. 

She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for the treatment of her mother’s eyes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 47 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ambote's Group

texts.en:
Ambote, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2008 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Ambote will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Ambote plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Ambote’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and has four children, two who are in school.  She is married.

Betty is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Betty has been farming bananas for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Jacklyne, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Jacklyne joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Jacklyne plans to save more money for the future.

Among the 15 farmers in Jacklyne's Group, a total of nine acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sreychorm's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one kid living in Kampong Speu province, Sreychorm is 21 years old. For her family, she grows rice as her single main source of income and it earns her about 18,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first time for Sreychorm with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have enough clean water to use so her family can live in  good health.

loans.use: To buy water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of children's sweets to sell.

loans.name: Nankuyu Group

texts.en:
Abegail is in a white top in the picture. She is 50 years old and the mother of two children. She supports her family by selling mixed vegetables in a market. With the previous profits made she is able to feed her family three meals a day.

She wants this loan to purchase vegetables in large quantities to attract more customers in her neighborhood. Her ambition is to diversify her business by starting to sell beans when she has enough capital. As a woman she is independent, and she is thanking Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy mixed vegetables

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy supplies needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This new loan will go to additional supplies for doormat-making like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials, which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Consolacion hopes for good health and strength in every day and to be always free from sickness. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a mother of four who operates a farm, growing and selling pigs to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years and she earns well for her family.  

She took a new loan recently from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy feeds and repair the pig fence to expand her piggery. She plans to expand the farm by having more pigs to raise in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair the pig fence to expand her piggery

loans.name: Gulam

texts.en:
Gulam is a 39-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years, and he is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Gulam's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities including rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose.

Due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the products above to resell. Therefore, Gulam has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Gulam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase commodities for her husband's general store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is an energetic sixty-five year old widow who has a food vending business. A mother of seven adult children, she hails from Dulag, Leyte, in the Philippines. She makes and sells doughnuts (usually deep-fried from a flour dough, and typically either ring-shaped or without a hole and often filled) and moron (a two-toned rice cake made with both glutinous and regular rice flours, coconut milk, sugar, chocolate and peanuts, wrapped in banana leaves and steamed for an hour). She has been in the food vending business for more than ten years. 

Rosalia has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy cooking ware like a steamer and grinder, and additional ingredients like flour, margarine and sugar. This will help augment her income and make it possible for her to set aside some of the savings for future use.

Rosalia hopes to expand her business to be productive and to help her have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cooking ware and additional ingredients.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 42 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por su labor de elaboración y venta de Pancamel. Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijo de 11 años quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona, cónyuge se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes. Julio cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; habitada por gente llegada de la sierra, que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Julio se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Pancamel(comida para vacas lecheras), desde hace más de 12 meses. Adicionalmente se dedica al engorde y venta de ganado caprino y porcino. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería( panca y melaza.) Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 42 years old. He is in a relationship and lives in his own house with his partner and their 11 year-old son who studies in the local public school. Julio's partner raises and sells guinea pigs.  They are a close family and they live in a community located in the Lagunas district in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. This region is inhabited from people who came originally from the mountains and who work in ranching and agriculture.

Julio is known in the press for his work preparing and selling "Pancamel" (a type of food for milk cows). He has good personal and professional references. His business is the creation and sale of this Pancamel, which he has been doing for over a year. He also raises herds of goats and pigs. Julio needs this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise: dry corn husks and molasses. In the short-term, this loan will permit him to improve his income and his earnings; and in the long run it will enable him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase corn husks and molasses.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 46 years old, married and blessed with four children. Lilian has been selling both new and second-hand clothes for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more variety of clothes for sale.  

Lilian will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and to be stable in her business.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en:
Estrelieta is 32 years old and has three children. Estrelieta is married, and two children are in school.

Estrelieta is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Estrelieta requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Estrelieta has been farming bananas for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrelieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Chhnang province, Roeun is 39 years old and a mother of five children. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises pigs. Moreover, she buys rice for resale to earn more income. 

This is her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in chemistry. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in chemistry.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat was born in 1975. She is married and has four children. Sayohat always tries for the well-being of her four children, and she wants to help them to get higher education. 

With the purpose of earning a living during the past 10 years, Sayohat has been busy with own business deal. She has been busy with buying and selling jewelries. She sells her goods in a local market where she has a store. 

Sayohat’s son studies at the university, and she must pay for his tuition. Sayohat is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD to pay for her son’s university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Alma aims to be able to save enough to buy their own lot. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Emelinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her peanut butter business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her peanut butter.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 41, is a married farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She earns income to support her family via cassava growing and rice cropping on one hectare of land. Currently, she can earn about 41,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. This is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. Sopheap will use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her farmland. She hopes that she can produce higher yields than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her farmland.

loans.name: Channat's Group

texts.en:
Channat is 51 years old and a mother of four children who are living in Kampong Cham province. To support the family's living conditions, she grows beans and rice. She can earn income of about 35,000 KHR per day. 

For Channat, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

In a group of two, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield so she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun, a local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 35 years old and a mother of two children. To improve her condition, she grows rice on a 1-hectare area and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is second loan cycle for Sun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions in a gradual pace. She leads a group of three to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for harvesting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is made up of eight farmers from the Butere District of Kenya, represented by group leader Jane, who is pictured above. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. Jane has been a farmer for four years and is considered to be very experienced.

Jane is not new to One Acre Fund, having actually joined the program in 2013. She has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jane will not only buy fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this since she will be able to have light during the night so her children can study.

Using this loan, Jane's Group will buy a total of four solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a combined total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en: A resident from Kampong Speu province, Savoeun is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She secures the basic needs of her family via rice cropping. She has been involved in her business for 30 years and earns only 5,000 KHR per day. For Sovoeun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will be healthy.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chhil's Group

texts.en: Chhil, 56, is a local resident in Kampong Speu province and a mother of four children. She is a farmer who does rice cropping as the main source of income to support her family's condition. This business returns about 30,000 KHR per day to her. For Chhil, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: A local resident of Kampong Speu province, Phat is 46 years old and a mother of three dependent children. She grows rice on two hectares as her  main source of income. Moreover, she can earn an income of about 10,000 KHR per day to support her family's basic needs. For Phat, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In the group of five members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Saed

texts.en: Saed is a 22-year-old single man.  He lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. He studied until secondary school but he couldn't compete his studies. Saed now works as a driver on his own bus to transport people from one station to another. He works 15 hours a day. That long work time caused trouble for the bus. His bus needs maintenance and a new engine.  Unfortunately, Saed doesn't have enough money to pay for this. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new engine and to do the necessary maintenance on his bus. Saed looks forward to purchasing a new bus that works well.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine and to do the necessary maintenance on his bus.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: A villager living in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia, Sophal is 48 years old and a mother of two children. She supports her family via rice cropping, their sole source of income. She can earn an income of about 20,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. For Sophal, this is her first loan application with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is leading a group of seven people to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on buying a water filter. She wants her family to have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en:
Leah is a 50-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Leah has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Leah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Leah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more embroidery items for her husband's business

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group of 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is 64 years old and a married father of six children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Mourice has been a farmer for eight years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Mourice wanted to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Mourice hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights, as, even though Mourice decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Oyby

texts.en:
Oyby was born in 1955.  She is a woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime partner’s name is Atam. They live in the house she has succeeded in building thanks to her great dedication.

She is one of the successful businesswomen of her region. For more than 10 years, she has been busy buying and selling industrial goods. She sells kettles, baskets, mops, etc. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and in this way, improve her living conditions. Her husband helps her with the business. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

She is asking for a loan of 9,000 Somoni to buy industrial goods to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy industrial goods to increase her working capital

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell. 

Jenny has been in this business for 10 years and she earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vannorng's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Kampong Speu province, Vannorng is 45 years old and a mother of five children. To support her living, she grows rice as the main source of her income. She can earn an income of about 10,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can live in good health.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en: Guldasta was born in 1965. She is divorced and has a child. Guldasta lives with her family in the southern part of Tajikistan. She has been busy with buying and selling food items for more than seven years. Guldasta sells a variety of food items. Her store is located near her house. Many of her customers are her neighbors. Guldasta is going to increase her working capital and in this way, attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy sugar, butter, pasta, etc. to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy sugar, butter, pasta, etc. to increase her working capital

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en: Kimsan, 42, is a mother of two school children living in Kampong Speu province. For her living, she earns income to support her family via rice cropping and she earns about 18,000 KHR per day. For Kimsan, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to use like other families.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe's Group is formed of 16 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Wycliffe, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 53 years old, married and has three children. Wycliffe has been a farmer for 12 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Wycliffe isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had more profit from each harvest ever since. This year, Wycliffe will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this, since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Wycliffe's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.75 acres

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
A kind woman by the name of Malohat lives in a house that is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who is busy with manufacturing. They have three clever children. Her children want to live in a house that is in good condition but her income from buying and selling carrots is not enough to pay for it. She must repair her house since it is in bad condition but she does not have enough money to pay for it. She is asking for a loan of 3,600 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint to repair her house.
 
In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint to repair her house

loans.name: Nalinda

texts.en:
Nalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Nalinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan helped to establish her business. She was able to grow her funds used for her junk-shop. The loan also helped her to cover the educational expenses of her children and to pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can further improve her business if you lend her an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will pay for more scrap and recyclable materials which she needs to increase her profit from the business. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to meet the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Raquel aims to give her children the best education, which currently they don't have. She wants their lives to be improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adzo Louise

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, ADZO est divorcée et mère de quatre enfants ; elle habite le quartier Adidogomé et vend des pagnes de diverses qualités depuis 2012 et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. ADZO sollicite un prêt en vue de pouvoir prendre soins de ses enfants et réaliser ses rêves de devenir un des plus grands fournisseurs de pagnes de son pays.
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Adzo is divorced and a mother of four children. She lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood and has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] of varying quality since 2012. She procures her goods twice a month.

Adzo is seeking a loan to help her take care of her children and realize her dreams of becoming one of the largest suppliers of pagnes in her country.

loans.use: to buy five lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est revendeuse de produits de beauté. Elle exerce seule l'activité au marché depuis 2009 et s'approvisionne au même lieu. Elle se tourne vers WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. A l'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir l'activité et assurer l'auto-suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Akossiwa est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge.
texts.en:
Akossiwa sells beauty products. She has been procuring her goods and making her sales at the market since 2009. 

She turned to WAGES in order to buy merchandise and respond to her customers' needs.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and ensure that her family is self-sufficient on food. Akossiwa is married and has two children under her care.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
Saif applied for a first Youth Loan from Kiva lenders to purchase many kinds of goods, food products and other items for his small grocery store. He really thanks Kiva lenders warmly for this first loan which helped him very much to grow his business more. Through the first loan, Serif was able to attract more customers. 

Having finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan, Saif has applied for a second Youth Loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva lenders to buy another amount of food products, items and other goods for his grocery store, to be able to meet all the demands of his customers. 

Saif hopes to be financed in this loan too.

loans.use: to buy another amount of food products, items and other goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Ablavi  Honorine

texts.fr: ABLAVI est mariée et mère d’un seul enfant ; âgée de 41 ans, elle vend des friperies dans les environnants du quartier Adidogomé où elle habite et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Dans le souci d’améliorer son quotidien et assurer son lendemain et celui de son enfant, ABLAVI désire un microcrédit pour appuyer son commerce étant donné qu'elle est un dame très dynamique.
texts.en:
Ablavi is married and a mother of one child. She is 41 years old. 

Ablavi sells used clothing [and linens] in the surrounding areas of the Adidogomé neighborhood, where she lives. She procures her goods twice a month.

With the goal of improving her everyday life and ensuring the future for her child, Ablavi is seeking a micro-loan to support her business, given that she is a very dynamic woman.

loans.use: to buy two dozen sheets and two dozen towels

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Femme de 36ans, Akouvi a deux enfants en charge. En 2013, elle a ouvert son restaurant bar et se fait aidée par 01e personne . Elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des spaghetti, des boissons, des œufs .... Elle souhaite devenir grossiste et aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en:
At 36 years old, Akouvi has two children under her care. In 2013, she opened a restaurant bar and has one employee.

She is seeking her first loan to buy spaghetti, drinks, eggs, etc. 

Akouvi wishes to become a wholesaler and help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti, drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Wendkouni N°1 De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDBI BASILE est responsable du groupe WENDKOUNI N°1 DE BINGO. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 02ans et ne va pas à l’école.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis plus de 06ans. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de kokologho.
Il veut s’acheter 02 boites de tomate, 02 boites d’oignons et 01 sac d’engrais.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut ajouter une autre activité. Mr ambitionne pouvoir stocker les produits comme les semences, etc.
texts.en:
Koudbi Basile is the leader of the Wendkouni #1 De Bingo group. Married, he is the father of one child, who is two years old and does not go to school.

Koudbi Basile has been in market gardening for six years. He procures his goods at the Kokologho market. He would like to buy two boxes of tomatoes, two boxes of onions, and one bag of fertilizer.

With his earnings, he would like to start another business. He hopes to be able to stock products like seeds, etc.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of tomatoes, two boxes of onions, and one bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Souadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 05 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 14 novembre 2009 il y a 10 cycle. La solidarité, l'entente anime ce Bv qui regroupe les femmes qui viennent du même quartier et des alentours. La plupart fait le commerce.
Souadou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 sont scolarisés. Elle envisage de poursuivre son commerce de vente de vaisselles et toutes marchandises à sa portée à savoir tissus, détergents et autres. Le transport des marchandises lui revient à 50000 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle soutient son mari et s'occupe des besoins de ses enfants et de ses parents, frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
This group of five members makes up a part of the banc villageois that was created on 14 November 2009. They are now on their tenth cycle.

Solidarity and understanding are what drive this group of women, who come from the same neighborhood and surrounding areas. They mostly work in commerce.

Souadou, who is standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of six children, of whom five attend school. 

Souadou plans to continue her business selling crockery, and all related goods, such as fabrics, detergents, etc. Transport of merchandise costs her 50,000 francs.

With her earnings, she supports her husband to take care of their children's needs and those of their parents, brothers, and sisters.

loans.use: to sell crockery

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Editha is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal for her buy and sell charcoal business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Cristina Suyapa

texts.es: Cristina de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Cristina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristina, 45, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter.
She has worked selling personal products for several years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells her products on the street in different areas. Cristina is requesting a loan to bulk buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants etc. so she can continue to work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants etc.

loans.name: Romarita

texts.en:
Romarita is 60 years old and married with three children.

Romarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Romarita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming bananas.

Romarita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 47-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Beatrice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Beatrice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old and is a married woman. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joseph has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9 acres of land and purchase a total of 18 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Jacob, who has been a farmer for more than 30 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Jacob has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Jacob started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Jacob’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Humor

texts.en:
Humor was born in 1976. She is married and has 3 children. Humor is a hardworking business lady from South Tajikistan. She lives there with her husband and children. Humor's husband is also a business man. Humor has been busy buying and selling clothes for 15 years. She sells clothes in a local market where she has a store.

She is going to buy women's clothes for the new winter season. She is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni with this aim. Humor, with a good credit history behind her, hopes for the support and trust of her lenders.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new winter season.

loans.name: Vilma  Aracely

texts.es: Vilma de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Vilma esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Vilma, 45, lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has made clothes for 15 years with her workshop in her home and she has many customers due to the quality of her clothes. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. and so to continue her work to generate good profits.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Nayda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nayda Elizabeth tiene 20 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus abuelos, vivienda construida de material rustico (adobe y techo de teja). La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. El lugar donde vive es un caserio de aproximadamente 100 familias dicho caserio tiene aproximadamente 45 años de creación política y está ubicado en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nayda Elizabeth es venta de chicha de jora y piqueos. La actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, dicha venta la realiza en su vivienda aquí prepara la chicha y vende los fines de semana a los pobladores de su comunidad. El destino del crédito es para compra de servico domestico para el negocio es decir necesita comprar mesas y sillas; además de harina para preparación de chicha. La inversión le ayudará incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que la zona hay consumo de este producto, debido a que en la zona hay empresas que generan empleo para los pobladores de la comunidad. Nayda Elizabeth piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año su negocio viene siendo más conocido en la zona, así mismo sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nayda Elizabeth, 20, is single and has no children. She lives with her grandparents in a house built of rustic materials (adobe and roof tiles). Life in this place is quiet and its population is engaged in agriculture and livestock. Where she lives is a hamlet of about 100 families with approximately 45 years of political establishment, located in the district of La Matanza, province of Morropón, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.
Nayda Elizabeth sells chicha and snacks. She has done this for 2 years from home where she prepares and sells chicha at the weekends to the people of the community. This loan is to buy products for her business, ie to buy furniture, plus flour for preparing chicha. This investment will help increase sales and earn more income for her family.
The market has good prospects because there is consumption of this product in the area because there are companies that create jobs for the residents of the community in the area. Nayda Elizabeth plans to continue investing in her business year after year since the business is becoming more known in the area, also its sales are growing. In this way, she will obtain better profits that allow for a medium or short term increase in revenues.

loans.use: to buy products for her business, for example tables and chairs, as well as flour to make chicha.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pig fattening business.

Purita has been in this business for 6 years. Purita earns additional income as a fish pond operator and buying and selling mud crabs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Hovq village where she lives with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law and 2-year-old grandson. Karine's son is a migrant worker in Russia, where he works hard to support his family financially. 

To cover the family's basic needs and earn daily income, Karine runs a farm. On the farm she keeps four cows, calves and hens and cultivates corn, haricots, potatoes, plums, quinces, nuts, apples and pears. Karine sells the gathered harvest in nearby communities. 

The requested loan is very important for her to enlarge her farm by buying two more calves, one cow and forage for feeding the cattle. She hopes and relies on lenders' support to collect the necessary amount of money.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, two calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pest control etc.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ritchel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ritchel has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ritchel has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 52 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Adelfa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Adelfa has requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing like pants,  shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Adelfa has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like pants, shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 48-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are in school.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business raising chickens in the Philippines. Rosalina has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Rosalina has been raising chickens for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She is grateful for the 35,000 PHP loan previously granted to her. She used it to buy grocery products needed in her general store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and towards their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise for her business. She will also purchase additional stocks of LPG since she also resells them for additional income. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to pay for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia hopes to be able to buy her own house sooner. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and stocks of LPG.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
María Esmeralda tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, en esta zona la vida es muy pasiva y tranquila y su población se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

María Esmeralda se dedica a las actividad de cria y venta de animales menores, tales como pavos, cuyes, patos, entre otros; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, María Esmeralda solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento de engorde balanceado para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor número de ventas. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda, 55, is married and lives in a rural area in the district Cayaltí in province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives with her husband and son at home. In this area, life is very passive and quiet and its population is mainly engaged in agriculture, livestock and trade.
Maria Esmeralda breeds and sells small animals, such as turkeys, guinea pigs and ducks, among others. With over 5 years of experience in the business, which is located in her home, Maria Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy animals and fattening food for them. This investment will serve to cater to more sales, allowing her to improve her income in the short term and increase profits and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and fattening food for them.

loans.name: Fernandita

texts.en:
Fernandita is 54 years old and married with seven children.

Fernandita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Fernandita has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Fernandita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business in the cloth trade for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Nusrat has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of different cloth for the summer and winter seasons by taking into account the fashion and taste of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income. She hopes that this financial help will grow her business and she will be able to provide good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of different cloth for the summer and winter seasons by taking into account the fashion and taste of her customers.

loans.name: Yeman

texts.en:
Yeman is 52 years old, a widow, and she has a son. Her son is married, and he has two kids. He is working as a taxi driver, but his salary is not enough to cover family needs. For this reason, Yeman  has always worked in agriculture, growing corn, potatoes, onions and tomatoes. She has worked hard in this field for 32 years. She works from early morning till late evening. She sells this harvest in the local market, and that is how she makes an income to provide for the family. 

Yeman always tries to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Azn from Aqroinvest CU  to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. 

This loan will help her to continue her business deal. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, soft drinks, junk foods, shampoos, beverages, laundry soaps, dish washing liquid, candies and seasonings

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselyn is 33 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Roselyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.en:
Husniddin is 19 years old; he comes from south Tajikistan. Husniddin is not married, and lives with parents. He is a very smart and hardworking young man. He is in his second year at Energy University of Tajikistan. He is one of the best students, and he reads a lot of books. He likes physics. 

Husniddin tries to get a good education. 

He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been providing beauty parlor services for seven years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials, etc. By providing her best services, she has become very famous in her area. 

In order to meet the increasing demand of her customers, she requires more variety of cosmetics for her parlor.  For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation, and applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. 

She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time.
