loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 48-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been providing the services of cooking (catering) in their own home from many years.  Zubida likes to make food, and she became famous in her town for providing tasty food. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends it to respective places. 

She is a responsible mother of six children, and needs to earn more to meet the daily expenditures of her family members. 

That is why she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more stock such as rice, packs of oil, salt and spices to fulfill the demand of all customers. 

In this way she will be able to increase her sales and as a result, earn more income.  Zubida wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, packs of oil, salt and spices

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. Her husband provides additional income for the family.

Rose is a farmer, and she sells cereals. She has been doing these businesses for the last four years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 4,000.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 10,000, which she will use to buy an additional stock of assorted cereals to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Rose will be able to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a stable business; that implies stable farming, and stable cereals sales.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of cereals

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 26 years old. Aiza works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Aiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Aiza has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, canned goods, etc.
 
In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ronelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, two of whom are in school, Ronelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ronelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Ronelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Deodema

texts.en:
Deodema is 59 years old, and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Deodema has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses, and shoes.

Deodema has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, sugar, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling native products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, sugar, etc

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 56 years old and has five children. She is a married woman, and has one child in school.

Aniceta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aniceta has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 53 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Remegia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Remegia has been raising pig for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is from Kapan, Syunik region. She has been involved in a retail business for 10 years.

Her only occupation is a small shop where she sells a great assortment of clothing. Emilia lives with her husband, who drives a taxi using his own car, and also helps her with running the shop.

The requested loan is important for Emilia to purchase a new stock of winter clothing for the store, and to be able to meet customers' demands. 

Emilia hopes for her loan to be funded so she will be able to enlarge the variety of clothing that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of winter clothing for the store

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 35-year-old married lady. She has been running a business of cattle purchase and sales with her husband for many years. They want to provide good health, food, and basic necessities to their family. 

To support their family in a better way, they started doing the animal rearing at home. Her husband purchases cattle from different places, and sells those to local markets; Perveen looks after these animals. They are happily doing this business together. 

Now Perveen requested a loan amount of PKR 40,000 from Kashf to purchase more calves and goats in order to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more calves and goats

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been buying and selling cattle for many years. Razia fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have a few goats. 

In order to increase their earnings, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more goats to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts. 

Razia is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.name: Merisyl

texts.en:
Merisyl sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more if you will lend her an amount of 23,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from improving her general store, Merisyl also wants her children to complete their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn is 45 years old and married with six children, three of them are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Annielyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo and beverages.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Annielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en:
Sadam is a 23-year-old married man and a father of only one child, living with his family in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. Sadam studied through the elementary education level, but he couldn't complete his study. 

The house where Sadam and his parents live is very small and not big enough for all the members of the family. Sadam has a piece of land beside the house of his father. He decided to build his own house on that land but he doesn't have enough money to do this. 

As a result, Sadam applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, gravel, iron, and steel to build a small house.

Sadam looks forward to completing all the building of his house on that land and renovating it from the inside to be ready for living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, gravel, iron, and steel to build a small house.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Delia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her kitchen to have more space, comfort, and, above all, better conditions.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old, with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

Norma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jerralyn

texts.en:
Jerralyn is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one daughter who is now at school age.

Jerralyn has been engaged in her hog-fattening business for two years already. She is also receiving support from her husband. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of grower feed for her existing hog-fattening business.

Jerralyn has been a member of PMPC for more than seven years. In the future, Jerralyn hopes to build more pig fences for her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of grower feed for her existing hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, eggs, fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
Fhevie is thankful for the 25,000 PHP loan granted to her because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of PHP 30,000. She will again use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fhevie dreams to expand her business sooner and improve the general living condition of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 67 years old and a widow with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vivencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, beverages, etc..

Vivencia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending, pig fattening and tricycle passenger transport. Rowena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 58 years old and widowed with seven children. Wenefreda works very hard to provide for them.

Wenefreda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

Wenefreda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

In the future, Wenefreda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Aya 1 Group

texts.en:
Aya 1 Group is a remarkable hardworking group, where the members put so much effort to develop their businesses and social living in a well-managed way.

Zeinab, Mariam and Zeinab are the three loyal members of this  group, who decided to hold hands and stand for their future improvement through a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.

Zeinab is the featured borrower of Aya 1 group (the lady at the far right side of the picture). She is a 29-year-old married mother of two who works in selling beauty cosmetics, perfumes and accessories to support her beloved husband, who is employed with a limited monthly income, in developing their family's living.

She runs her business from her house, but her dream is to expand it and move to a bigger shop with a special location to attract more customers and increase her income. Unfortunately, currently she saves little money from her acquired income to increase her business merchandise or open her separate shop because of her family's increasing living needs. 

For this reason, Zeinab will invest her current loan in increasing her business merchandise before Christmas with special autumn and winter cosmetics and beauty creams.

As for the other group members, Mariam is the first one at the far left side of the picture, while Zeinab is at the left.

loans.use: To Increase her business merchandise before Christmas with special autumn and winter cosmetics and beauty creams.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy additional hogs and feed, which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again, this time an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of feed and hogs, which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also enable her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Lolita wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Houaida

texts.en:
Houaida is a 39-year-old married mother of one child. A year ago she started selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Houaida is a hard worker and has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate a shop and increase her business merchandise with a new fashionable winter collection to satisfy her customers' needs.

Houaida hopes to expand her business successfully to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate a shop and increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 56 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Ninfa has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, eggs, sugar, chips, groceries, etc. .

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling young coconut and charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, eggs, sugar, chips, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Maria is borrowing PHP 2,1000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise for her animal sales business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Reatrey

texts.en:
Reatrey is 24 years old. She is a third-year student at university, taking a banking and finance major. She is from Prey Veng province of Cambodia. 

Due to a lack of finances, she would like to secure a loan to pay for her tuition fees for the third and fourth years. This loan will help her graduate with a skill to build her future. 

After graduation, she wants to find a good job so she will be able to help support her siblings’ studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow blessed with, and taking care of, five children

Elizabeth is in mixed farming, a business she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Elizabeth has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000, which she will use to buy fertilizers, maize and bean seeds for planting. With the anticipated profits, Elizabeth will be able to improve her family's living standards as well as purchase more seedlings for planting.

Her hope for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Meline

texts.en:
Meline is married with two young children, aged four and three years old. She and her husband have been occupied in agriculture since they got married. 

On the farm, they keep livestock of 30 sheep and 18 cows and calves. This agricultural activity is the family's only source of income, and both Meline and her husband do their best to run the farm successfully.  

Meline asks for this loan of $3,000 (US) to purchase a pig, four piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. This investment will help her to enlarge her farming business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a pig, four piglets and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is 32 years old and has three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mariliza has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Mariliza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 43-year-old married woman from the village of Nojikhevi. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and school-aged son and daughter. 

Khatuna is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their children's educations.

To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Khatuna is engaged in cattle and pig breeding and in cultivation of laurel and citrus. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Khatuna wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of GEL 5,000 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to open general store in order to get stable source of income. 

She will work as sales lady also and will have her own loyal costumers among her neighbors and villagers. Khatuna and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To open a general store and get a stable source of income.

loans.name: Neonila

texts.en:
Neonila is a widow. She has two daughters. Neonila has a good business; she sells women's clothes. Neonila lives with one of her daughters in a small apartment. 

Neonila is planning to do a renovation in her apartment.  She is asking for a loan of the 30,000 UAH to repair two rooms and a balcony. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to repair two rooms and a balcony.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarina is a sewer. She lives and works in South Tajikistan. Zarina has been busy with her sewing business more than 3 years. Zarina serves her clients in her workshop. She manages the business alone.  She sews women's dresses and sells to local people.

Zarina periodically goes to Dubai and brings back a variety of fabrics. She is a very hardworking woman and always tries to develop her business. She is going to increase her business further. Zarina is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy fabrics to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabric to increase her working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from food-vending and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace 1 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija y su madre, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, 	huevos, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman's face is pixelated because she is 19 years old and lives in a high risk area. For a year, she has had a small store in her residence. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her daughter and her mother. She is asking for a loan to buy soups, snacks, beverages, basic grains, eggs, etc. so that she can continue with her sales and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy soups, snacks, beverages, basic grains, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 59-year-old single woman who lives in small village called Sujuna. Sadly, because of a lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Gulnara was unable to study a professional career.  She works hard growing maize on family-owned agricultural land, and she sells it locally. She always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Gulnara is also involved in dairy farming, taking care of cattle and milk cows to produce milk products for trading. 

In spite of these activities, this single woman finds it hard to earn a living and requested a loan for expanding her business. Gulnara was approved for the loan of 1,000 GEL with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives poor rural people the chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use the loan to purchase pigs, build a pigsty, and, after growing them, sell the pigs at a good price in the local market. With the support of the Start Up program, Gulnara will get an opportunity to enlarge her business and tackle the financial difficulties. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To expand her agribusiness and start selling pigs

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 44 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida  y sus dos hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, Ismael  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ismael is 44 years old. He lives with his life's companion and their two children. He has had a bread bakery located in his residence for 10 years. He has a lot of customers because of the quality he uses when making the bread. With his earnings he is able to get ahead with the household expenses. Ismael is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc., so that he can continue with his work and thus have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has improved her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Juanita is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her variety store, Juanita wants her house to undergo renovation. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años, anda sus productos en un camioncito liviano por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man's face is pixelated because he is 20 years and and lives in a high risk area. He has sold fruit and vegetables for 2 years. He goes around with his products in a small, lightweight truck to the different neighborhoods. He already has a lot of customers. He lives in his own home with his life's companion. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale because this is his only source of work and this way he can have more income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 40 years. Lourdes earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 35 años al cultivo de plátanos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con el cultivo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 66 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner. For 35 years he has made a living in banana farming. He sells his products in the various neighboring towns and he already has established customers. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control products, etc. to be able to continue farming and, through this, be able to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
A senhor Fatima professora  tem 31 anos de idade, mae casada de 3 filhas com 12,10 e 03 anos os dois a estudarem o ultimo ainda menor  idade  vive na casa do servico seu esposo que e militar.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco para varroes, para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro  terminar a construcao de sua casa propria terminar a sua faculdade esta no 2º ano do ensino basico.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Fatima is 31 years old and works as a teacher. She is married and has three children who are 3, 10 and 12 years old. Two of her children are in school and the youngest is still at home. Her husband is in the military and they live in military housing.

With this loan she would like to continue with a construction project by buying sand, stone, and zinc plates. In the future, Fatima would like to finish building her house and finish her schooling. She is currently in her second year studying elementary education.

Fatima promises to pay back the loan on time and will take out more loans in the future to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: buy sand, stone, and zinc plates.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is married. He has three small children. Robert works as a school and kindergarten director. He is very hardworking person. He lives in a  one-storey house with his wife and children, and he wants to give the best to his family.

Robert is asking for a loan of 25,000 UAH to install three windows and a front door in his house. Also he wants to insulate the walls. This loan will help Robert to save money on heating in winter.

loans.use: to install three windows and a front door and insulate the walls

loans.name: Alexi Marilan

texts.es: Alexis de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y mas pollos para continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Alexis is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner. For 15 years he has made a living by breeding chickens and pigs. He sells his products in various markets, and with the sales he makes he is able to get ahead.

The customer is requesting a loan to buy feed and more chickens, in order to continue breeding. This is his only source of work and this will help him have better income.

loans.use: to buy feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-drying business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past ten years, and she also earns more income from pig fattening. Geneva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and wants to further build her businesses.

Geneva is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to make dried fish for her business. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is a 56-year-old widow woman who lives in the capital of Georgia. She doesn’t have family members and earns a living herself. For the past eight years, Nunu has been working as a cleaner and she earns 300 GEL per month. The work is hard for her and her salary isn’t enough to keep her financially stable. Nunu has great desire to start an additional business activity and generate more income. She has requested loans from local financial institutions to start her own business but her application has been rejected several times due to her unstable financial condition or lack of experience. 

Nunu is requesting a 400 USD loan to purchase various patterns and start a sewing business. She already has a sewing machine and she will get clients for various orders. The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, has given her a chance to be involved in her own business. Nunu’s loan will help this hardworking woman and she will get the opportunity to generate more income and live in better conditions. She awaits your support and kindness and will be really grateful for Kiva lenders and their help.

loans.use: to purchase patterns and start a sewing business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 44 years. She is married and blessed with three children. Her spouse provides additional income for the family.

Rosemary sells charcoal, a business she has done for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Rosemary has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 10,000 KES which she will use to buy additional sacks of charcoal for resale. With the anticipated profits, Rosemary will be able to boost and expand her business even further by ensuring she always has extra sacks of charcoal to avoid running out.

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jeanefer

texts.en:
Jeanefer is 28 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from pig fattening. Jeanefer has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Jeanefer is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as chips, soap, sugar, coffee, and other products. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as chips, soap, sugar, coffee, and other products

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sofia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Sofia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy clothing materials for her tailoring business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sofia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and other items for her business

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Angeles has been in this business for six years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of  loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house

loans.name: Enisio

texts.pt:
Senhor Enίsio tem 40 anos de idade, é casado, é militar, tem quatro filhos dos quais três estudam frenquentando ensino primário e secundário respetivamente, vive em casa própria com a sua familia a qual ele sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia pedra, varrões para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro espera terminar a construção da sua casa e iniciar a construção de uma outra casa noutro terreno para o futuro dos filhos.
O seu desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Enisio is 40 years old and is in the military. He is married and has four children, three of whom are in elementary or high school. He lives with his family in their own home and they depend on him financially.

With this loan Enisio would like to continue with his home construction project by buying sand, cement, stone, and poles. In the future, he would like to finish the construction project and start building a house on another lot for his children's future. His main goal is to pay off this loan on time in order to guarantee his eligibility for future loans.

loans.use: continue with a home construction project by buying sand, cement, stone, and poles.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 26 years old. She is a married manicurist with two small children living in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has been a manicurist since 2011, earning approximately $4 per day. One of her children is a student. Her husband is a 30-year-old carpenter running a wood handicraft, earning approximately $7 per day. 

Now Navy would like to request a loan to buy zinc sheets, doors and windows to build a house. This loan will help her and her family have a proper house for living. 

In the future, she is going to help her husband expand his handicraft and send her youngest child (with her in the photo) to school.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, doors and windows to build a house

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.en:
Orzugul was born in 1965. She is married and lives with her family in Tajikistan. She is a very industrious woman. 

Twenty years ago, Orzugul began her own business deal buying and selling clothing. She sells clothes in a local market where she has a store. Orzugul has great experience in this business and her experience helps her to develop business further. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy a car, as she needs a car for transporting her goods. Orzugul awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a car for transporting her goods

loans.name: Jacinter

texts.en:
Jacinter is 40 years and married. For the past seven years, she has run a hotel business and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Jacinter’s spouse provides additional income for the family.

Jacinter is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a stock of cooking ingredients such as cooking oil, matchboxes, milk, bread, washing soap, and other goods. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to expand her business even further. In the future, Jacinter hopes and dreams of increasing her business and recording a profit of at least 30,000 KES a month.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her hotel

loans.name: Kurbonaly

texts.en:
Kurbonaly is a student of the second course Agriculture University of Tajikistan. He is a very smart man. Kurbonaly studies well. He is trying to get a high quality education and to be a good specialist in future.

Kurbonaly reads many books and often goes to the library. He is not married and lives with his parents. His parents have no opportunity to pay for his tuition and that’s why he is asking for a loan of 850 USD to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition in the second course, Agriculture University of Tajikistan.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Linda has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kashif

texts.en:
Kashif is a 28-year-old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of three children and by profession he is an owner of a motorbike spare parts shop. He has been running his business for the past ten years. 

Kashif wants to expand the size of his business so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of motorbike spare parts, but due to financial problems he is not in a position to bear these expenses.

Therefore he has applied for Kiva SEP loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expenses in the expansion of his business and buy relevant items to fulfill his customers' needs. For this financial assistance, Kashif is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Senhor Ernesto tem 35 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 2 filhos, dos quais um estuda frenquentando ensino secundário,é canalizador e  trabalha numa empresa privada na área de manunteção  vive na casa própria, e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de portas, cimento, areia para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro espera oficializar o seu casamento, e terminar a construção da sua casa e meter mobiliario.
O seu grande desafio é de garantir o sustento familiar, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a solicitar mais pedidos de empréstimo na Hluvuku e consequentimente concretizar seus projectos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 35 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in high school. He works as a plumber in the maintenance department of a private company. He and his family live in their own home and he's not financially responsible for anyone else.

With this loan Ernesto would like to continue with a home construction project by buying doors, cement, and sand. In the future, he would like to finish the construction project, furnish his home, and make his marriage official.

Ernesto's main goal is to guarantee his family's well-being and pay off this loan on time so that he can take out subsequent loans with Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] and make his plans a reality.

loans.use: continue with a home construction project by buying doors, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Adelaide's Group

texts.en:
Adelaide, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Adelaide will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. Adelaide plans to use the profits she earns this year to save more money for the future.

In total Adelaide’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Sana has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sana's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily, and will be able to provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Sana also plans to put aside savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Sana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the expense of her husband's taxi repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, windows, and window railings, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Monica

texts.pt:
Senhora Mónica tem 44 anos de idade, é casada, e tem cinco filhos dos quais dois estudam frenquentando ensino secundário, é negociante a mais de 20 anos, vive em casa própria com a sua familia a mesma que ela sustenta com ajuda do seu esposo.
O dinheiro financiado será aplicado na compra de sacos de feijão, amendoim, para revender no mercado local.
No futuro espera ampliar o seu negócio, explorando na área de importação de produtos para revender no mercado interno.
Nao teve oprtunidade para estudar para mais além , assim sendo luta para garantir o sustentento escolar dos filhos e reembolsar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora
texts.en:
Monica is 44 years old and is married with five children, two of whom are currently in high school. For more than 20 years she's worked in sales, and she lives in her own home with her family, which she supports with help from her husband.

Monica will use this loan to buy sacks of beans and peanuts to sell at a local market. In the future, she would like to expand her business by looking for goods to import and then sell in the domestic market.

Because Monica didn't have the chance to finish her studies, one of her main goals is to ensure that her children will be able to stay in school. Her other main goal is to pay off this loan as indicated.

loans.use: buy sacks of beans and peanuts to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael de 34 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de Hot Dogs desde hace 13 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio vende de forma ambulante en su carretón por las diferentes colonias, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Misael solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus alimentos como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y reparar el carretón que muestra en la fotografía y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
Misael is 34 years old and has had a business selling hot dogs for the past 13 years.  He has a good customer base since he sells his food at a good price.  He sells his food from a small cart in the street, traveling through different neighborhoods. 

He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children.  Misael is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy all that is necessary to make his food, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadella sausages, and other ingredients.  It will also allow him to repair his cart, which is shown in the photo.  This will help him increase his income and continue helping with the household expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadella sausages, and other ingredients for his hot dog stand.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She is grateful for the 20,000 PHP loan preciously granted to her. She used the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. The more items she sells will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita wants her business to continue to flourish. She also dreams to buy their own house and plot someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from pottery making.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with four children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, biscuits, canned goods, etc. 

Looking forward, Erlinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has her own shop where she sells different food products (fruits and vegetables, candies and juices, bread, butter, cheese, etc). Gayane's store is located in a busy part of Kapan town, so she has many clients. 
Gayane lives with her husband, who greatly supports her with the business. 
The requested amount is very important for this charming woman in the photo, Gayane will use the loan to pay for new stock of food supplies for her store. This will help her to continue running her store efficiently. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of food supplies for her store

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Julie is 26 years old and two of her children are in school.

Julie has a bicycle transportation business in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for renovating her bike taxi.

Julie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for renovation of her bike taxi

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Doña Marta de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her husband who works as a driver. For 5 years she has made a living in clothing sales. She sells as a street vendor in the different communities and she has a lot of customers because of her good prices. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes at wholesale, in order to continue her sales. This is her only source of work and this will allow her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Maymes Manely

texts.es: Maymes de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace  10 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder seguir con sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maymes, 31, lives in her own house with her life partner and her son.  She has earned a living growing corn for 10 years.  She sells her crops in various markets.  She's able to get ahead with what she earns from her sales and her husband's help.

Maymes is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc., so she can keep on making sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food and fish vending.  Genalyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wend La Tongre De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est responsable du groupe WEND LA TONGRE DE BINGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des légumes et des céréales depuis plus de 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac d’arachide, 02sacs d’haricot.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à l’épanouissement de la famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un magasins de céréales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenabo is the leader of the Wend La Tongre De Bingo borrowers' group. She is married and has three children. The eldest is seven years old and the youngest is six months old. One of her children attends school.

Zenabo has been selling vegetables and cereals for over three years. She stocks up at her village market.
She would like to buy one bag of peanuts and two bags of beans. With her revenues, she would like to improve her family's quality of life. Her goal is to open a cereals  warehouse.

loans.use: to buy one bag of peanuts and one bag of peanuts.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 36 лет. Она уроженка города Душанбе. Душанбе столица Республики Таджикистана. Зулайхо в городе проживает вместе с 8 летним сыном. Она развелась с мужем и ребенка воспитывает одна. Зулайхо зарабатывает на жизнь путем предоставления услуги портнихи. Она берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. Зулайхо набралась большого опыта работы и теперь набирает учениц, чтобы обучить их своему мастерству. Зулайхо много лет работает на старой машинке, и она хочет на заемные деньги приобрести новую, чтобы улучшить условия работы и сделать процесс шитья гораздо удобнее. Поддержите ее!
texts.en:
Zulaykho is 36 years old. She is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. Dushanbe is the capital of the Republic of Tajikistan. Zulaykho lives in this city together with her 8 year old son. She was divorced from her husband and is raising her child alone. 

Zulaykho earns a living through providing a seamstress service. She takes orders for sewing women's national clothing. Zulaykho has gained a lot of experience and is currently taking students to teach them her skill. 

Zulaykho has worked with an old sewing machine for many years and she would like to borrow money to purchase a new one, in order to improve her working conditions and make the process of sewing much easier. Please help her!

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some of new housewares for her house

loans.name: Tegawende Group

texts.fr:
Mr NOAGA est responsable du groupe TEGAWENDE. Marié, il est père de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins 08ans. 02vont à l’école.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis plus de 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 20 poules, 05 moutons et 05 chèvres.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut participer à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr Noaga is the leader of the group called Tegawende. Married, he is the father of seven children. The oldest is 30 and the youngest eight years old. Two of them go to school. 

He has been raising livestock for more than 10 years. He buys his animals and supplies in surrounding markets. He wants to buy 20 chickens, five sheep, and five goats. 

With his profit, he wants to improve his family's living conditions. His ambition is to become an important livestock raiser.

loans.use: to buy himself 20 chickens, 5 sheep, and 5 goats

loans.name: Yav

texts.en:
Yav is a 51-year-old married farmer who lives in a village in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has four children in her care. One of her children is a garment-factory worker, one is a construction worker and two attend school. She has been a farmer since 1990. Her husband is 49 years old and he produces alcohol for sale. Together, they can earn approximately $18 daily. 

To improve her husband’s production, Yav would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more rice to produce alcohol to sell. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. For her future plans, she is going to buy piglets to fatten and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice to produce alcohol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more corn from the wholesaler, and lime powder

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Vitoria de 62 anos de idade casada e mae de 7  filhos, todos  sao independentes. Ela é operária agrícola numa empresa de produção de banana a mais de 6 anos.
Com o presente empréstimo irá comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, uma porta, barrotes e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes da habitacao.
texts.en:
Vitoria is 62 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom are grown. For more than six years she's worked on a farm for a large banana-growing operation.

With this loan Vitoria would like to continue with a home construction project by buying materials like cement, zinc plates, metal bars and a door, and paying workers to help with the construction. Her main goal is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy construction materials like cement, zinc plates, metal bars and doors, and pay construction workers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her vulcanizing shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она увеличила свою прибыль до 30,000 сом (KGS) и смогла накопить средства на покупку автомобиля. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей с финансированием. Дилфуза вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Она планирует приобрести женские и мужские вещи для перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса Дилфуза будет вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и увеличение ассортимента.
texts.en:
Dilfuza succesfully repaid her loan, after having used it as intended. She increased her income to 30,000 som (KGS) and was able to save money to purchase a car. She thanks Kiva and all who helped her with the financing.

Dilfuza again turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). She plans to purchase women's and men's clothing to sell. Dilfuza plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and increase the assortment.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing to resell in order to attract new clients

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Observing her, she is a picture of beauty. Her eyes dance in merriment as if to punctuate her animated gestures, and the hint of a smile plays at the corners of her mouth. Packed within her petite frame is a silent strength and character that you only begin to understand as you get to know her. This is Nancy, the Chief Human Resource Manager at Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural micro finance institution in Kenya that serves smallholder farmers.

At home, she is a committed wife to her husband and a tender, loving mother to her two children. Her small family means the world to her, so she puts them at the center of every single decision she makes in life. Growing up in a poor neighborhood, raised by poor parents, Nancy had plenty of reasons to follow the path of many girls in her hood. But she decided early in her life that she would define her own path through hard work, determination and flexibility. 

She made it through University with a Bachelor of Science in Leadership and Management where she got first class honors. Nancy, upon graduating with a degree in leadership, was just piercing into the Kenyan dream with the hope of setting up unmatchable standards in the human resources and leadership practice. Like many educated Kenyans, her life seemed promising and ever improving. However, in 2010, her husband was involved in a grisly road accident that left him devastated, motionless and unconscious. The accident also rendered her husband jobless. With a young family and a jobless husband, Nancy knew that she was to tread a rocky path with dark hanging clouds. However, Nancy vowed not to let her husband's accident suppress her dreams and determination to succeed.

Nancy is seeking a 500,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan, which she will use to pay for higher education. She is undertaking a Masters in Business Administration at the United States International University (U.S.I.U.) in Kenya. The course will help her to work with productivity objectives and targets aimed at the achievement of the company’s short- and long-term goals. She needs this loan from Kiva lenders, because her income is tied up, and the cost of the higher education is prohibitive. The biggest chunk of her salary is spent on general family expenses and her children’s education. She became the breadwinner in her family since the day her husband was involved in the grisly road accident and rendered jobless.

Nancy has grown within the ranks of the Human Resource profession from a Personal Assistant, HR Assistant, to HR Officer. Nancy joined Juhudi Kilimo in 2012 as the Human Resource Manager and what really attracted her to Juhudi is the core business of financing rural farmers. Having worked in a pure for-profit organization and in particular healthcare, Nancy’s desire was to join a social enterprise that would focus on the development of customers in a sustainable manner. She fell in love with Juhudi's mission, their client focus and the impact they were creating in society.

Nancy believes that Juhudi is at a point in time that it requires a strong and very skilled leadership team that will be able to deliver on the promises to the farmers. As an executive heading the HR function, Nancy will benefit greatly from the Masters in Business Administration from U.S.I.U. because the degree provides graduates an edge on the competition, especially for human resources management positions. Thriving businesses need great employees. They require talented and technically skilled employees to gain an edge in the marketplace—that’s why HR professionals play a vital role in the success of companies across an array of industries. 

With your loan, Nancy will continue providing for her family, educating her children and three other siblings, and furthering her education without having to stretch her income further. Nancy will use the newly acquired skills in implementing HR strategy, employee selection, talent management, compensation and benefits, training, development and formulating human resource law

Support this heroine who works tirelessly to improve the economic well-being of small holder farmers in Juhudi Kilimo and herself!

loans.use: To pay for a Masters in Business Administration at the United States International University in Nairobi, Kenya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sheep in order to further improve his business

loans.name: Atlaid's Group

texts.en:
Atlaid is a 38-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Atlaid has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Atlaid described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Atlaid’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Daisi Judit

texts.es: Daisi de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al destace de ganado vacuno y a la comercialización de la carne desde hace 11 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de reses vacunas por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Daisi is 48 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has had a business as a  butcher and meat vendor for 11 years. Her business is located in her home. With the money she earns, she is able to pay some of her household expenses. The client is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase bulk cattle to continue with her sales and make a better income.

loans.use: purchase  cattle.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and rice retailing. Elvira is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her rice mill operator business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice-mill business

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Искандар  мужчина 35 лет,женат,молодой отец троих детей.Он родился в сельской местности и с детства работал на поле,помогал родителям.Искандар не получил высшее образование ,потому что у его родителей не было средств для оплаты его обучения.Сейчас он занимается животноводством.На своём участке земли он ухаживает за скотом.У него 6 голос коров и одна лошадь.Молоко ,полученное от дойки коров,жена Искандара продаёт на рынке.Сейчас он хочет приобрести корм для скота,но не имеет нужной суммы.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой помощью.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу и выделит ему нужную сумму для поддержки и процветания его бизнеса.
texts.en:
Iskandar is a 35 years old man. He is married and the young father of three children. He was born in the countryside and since childhood he worked in the field, helping his parents. Iskandar did not get higher education, because his parents did not have money to pay for it. 

Currently, Iskandar works with livestock breeding. He takes care of livestock on his plot of land. He has six heads of cattle and one horse. Iskandar's wife sells the milk he gets from the dairy cows at the market. 

Currently Iskandar would like to purchase fodder for the livestock, but does not have the necessary money. Therefore he turned to MDO Arvand for financial help. He hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to his request and allocate the necessary amount to him to support his business and ensure its prosperity.

loans.use: to buy livestock fodder

loans.name: Uktamhon

texts.ru: Уктамхон - женщина 60 лет,замужем,мать пятерых детей. Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с детства помогала родителям по дому и на поле. В настоящее время Уктамхон занимается животноводством.На своём участке земли она ухаживает за крупным рогатым скотом.Молоко,полученное от коров,она продаёт на рынке.Несмотря на то,что Уктамхон в пожилом возрасте,у неё есть силы справляться со скотом.Ей также помогают её дети и внуки.Сейчас Уктамхон хочет купить корм для скота,но у неё нет нужной суммы.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Уктамхон заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Uktamhon is 60 and married with five children. She was born and raised in a rural area and helped her parents around the house and in the fields from childhood. She currently works in animal husbandry, tending cows on her own land. She sells the milk she gets from the cows at the market. Despite her advanced age, she still has the strength to work with cattle, and her children and grandchildren help as well.

Uktamhon wants to buy cattle feed but doesn't have the necessary amount of money. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for financial support. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Bimarhabo

texts.ru:
Бимархабо женщина 65 лет,замужем,мать четверых детей . В настоящее время занимается купле-продажей одежды,арендует помещение на рынке,где и ведёт свой бизнес.Торговля идёт хорошо.
Ей с мужем было сложно в те времена воспитывать четверых детей,не хватало денеги им приходилось работать на двух-трёх работах ,чтобы поставить на ноги своих детей.Несмотря на все сложности,им удалось дать свои детям хорошую жизнь.Сейчас также Бимархабо поддерживает своих детей,морально и материально.Её внук закончил школу в этом году и поступил в университет,но  его родители не имеют нужной суммы для оплаты образования.Поэтому Бимархабо решила помочь им и заплатить за учёбу внука.Но у неё нет полной суммы ,поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Она надеется ,что МДО Арванд откликнется на её просьбу и выделит  нужную сумму.Бимархабо заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Bimarhabo is a woman of 65 years. She is married and the mother of four children. Currently she works with clothing sales. She rents a stall at the market, where she conducts her business. The business is going well. She and her husband had a difficult time when they raised their children, as they did not have enough money and had to work 2-3 jobs in order to bring up their children.
