Despite all the difficulties, they managed to give their children a good life. 

Currently, Bimarhabo also supports her children, both morally and financially. Her grandson finished school this year and entered the university, however his parents do not have the necessary amount to pay for the education. Therefore Bimarhabo decided to help them and pay for her grandson's tuition. However, she does not have the full amount and therefore she turned to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hopes that MDO Arvand responds to her request and provide the necessary amount. Bimarhabo thanks for the support and confidence in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's education

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер молодой мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Алишер женат и имеет одного ребенка. Алишер живет в сельской местности и с детства занимается животноводством. Еще в раннем детстве отец подарил Алишеру несколько ягнят и Алишер сам вырастил их. С тех пор Алишер любит заниматься животноводством. В свободное время Алишер подрабатывает таксистом на своей машине, но основным источником дохода является животноводство. Жена Алишера работает в России на овощной базе. Алишер в данный момент испытывает острую нужду в финансах и с данной проблемой он обратился в "Арванд" за помощью. На полученные деньги Алишер хочет купить скот и корм для скота. Алишер выражает благодарность организации "Арванд" за помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Alisher is a young man of 30. He is married and has one child. He lives in a rural area and has been working in animal husbandry since childhood. Even as a young child his father gave him several lambs and Alisher raised them himself. Since then, he has loved working in animal husbandry. In his free time, Alisher also works as a taxi driver using his own car, but his primary source of income is animal husbandry. His wife works in Russia at a vegetable storage facility.

Alisher is currently experiencing great financial need and has turned to Arvand for help with this problem. He wants to buy cattle and feed with the loan funds. He would like to express his thanks to Arvand for their assistance to rural residents.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Doreli

texts.es:
Doreli tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Doreli se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado enla parte posterior de su domicilio, Doreli solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Doreli piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doreli, 34, has a partner and two children. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. Her community works primarily in agriculture, livestock and trade.

Doreli makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens, and guinea pigs. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. The business is located at the rear of her house. 

Doreli is requesting a loan to buy animals. This investment will allow her to have greater productivity and a larger variety of animals, and will have a large influence on the business. 

Doreli is thinking of increasing her animal stock in order to be able to meet the different tastes and needs of the clients of the area. This will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and therefore improve her own and her family´s quality of life in the short term.

loans.use: to buy animals, which will allow her to have greater productivity and a larger variety of animals

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан молодая женщина в возрасте 31 года, вдова и имеет 2 детей на иждивении. Гулшан живет в сельской местности и работает по найму на поле во время сезона. В свободное время Гулшан занимается вышиванием национальных женских платьев. Муж Гулшан погиб в России в следствии несчастного случая и ей приходиться одной воспитывать двоих детей. Гулшан хотела купить мебель для дома но испытывает нехватку в финансах и с данной проблемой обратилась в организацию "Арванд" за поддержкой и решила взять кредит.  Гулшан благодарит "Арванд" за предоставленную помощь малоимущим слоям населения сельских местностей.
texts.en:
Gulshan is a young woman of 31. She is widowed and is raising two children. She lives in a rural area and works as a seasonal wage labourer in the fields. In her free time, she works sewing women's dresses in the national style. Her husband was killed in Russia due to an accident and she has had to raise her children on her own. 

Gulshan wants to buy furniture for her home but doesn't have enough money. She turned to Arvand for support in this matter, and has decided to take out a loan. She thanks Arvand for the support they have offered to poor residents in rural areas.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region with her nice family. She is 45 years old, and she has a profession of teaching and has a higher education. She has worked at the school for over 23 years as a teacher of mathematics. With her perfect knowledge and very patient character, she also gives paid private courses at her house, preparing the pupils for entrance exams. 

Karine lives with her husband (he is a taxi driver) and her two school-aged children (a son and a daughter).
 
Karine will be greatly happy and thankful if Kiva lenders support her with a loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams, since she wants buy a computer  and new mathematical literature and manuals for her courses at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and new mathematical literature and manuals for her courses at home

loans.name: Batrobah's Group

texts.en:
Batrobah's Group includes 13 farmers from the Kakamega North District.  She is the group leader, is 38 years old, is married with three children. Batrobah has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Batrobah isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she joined the program in 2012 and since then her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Batrobah will get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will purchase a solar light. She is very excited about the loan because she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and save more money.

Batrobah's Group will purchase 11 solar lights and farming inputs to plant 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase 11 solar lights and farming inputs.

loans.name: Helio

texts.pt:
O SR. Francisco de 24 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filhos que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primaria. Ele è serralheiro  na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Francisco is 24 years old and is married with one child who is in elementary school. He has worked for more than three years for a commercial banana farm as a locksmith. 

Francisco will use this loan to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay construction workers to continue with his home construction project. His main goal is to improve his family's living conditions and nutrition.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay construction workers to help with a home construction project.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 20-year-old married woman who started three years ago working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Today, Amal is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying necessary beauty equipment to facilitate her work and satisfy her customers' needs.

Amal hopes to open her own shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty equipment

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia que cada día lucha incansablemente para poder brindar todo lo mejor a sus hijos porque más adelante quiere verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales, es una mujer muy emprendedora, por iniciativa propia empezó su propio negocio de venta de comidas típicas de la selva como juanes, tacacho con cecina, arroz chaufa de cecina, carne asada, entre otros. Ella se esfuerza mucho y cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable, tiene una excelente sazón y sus platillos son deliciosos y es muy amable con el clientes.
Mercedes tiene el sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un restaurante, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar mercadería como cecina, condimentos, abarrotes para así poder preparar más platillos e incrementar sus ventas. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad y continuará luchando para cumplir todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a mother who strives everyday to be able to give her children all the best, because later in life she wants to see them become great professionals. 

She's a very entrepreneurial woman. On her own initiative, she started her own business selling traditional foods from the jungle, like juanes (a boiled mixture of rice, meat and spices), tacacho (a roasted banana dish) with jerky, beef fried rice and carne asada, among others. 

She works very hard and believes her business is going well because she's very responsible, her dishes are delicious and have a good flavor, and she's very friendly with her clients.

Mercedes has a dream of being able to grow her business and turn it into a restaurant. Because of this, she's planning to use the loan to buy merchandise like cured meat, condimenta and groceries to be able to prepare more dishes and increase her sales. 

She's very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and will continue striving to achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food stall.

loans.name: Shamshi

texts.ru: Шамши 48 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Шамши среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на данный момент у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец, а также на участке мерою 1,40 Га арендованной и 0,87 Га собственной земли, Шамши выращивает ячмень и картофель для реализации. Также на ежедневной основе реализует молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 7,000 сом (KGS). Шамши известна как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Все накопленные от бизнеса денежные средства, она старается вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства. В этом году Шамши решила перекрыть крышу сарая для скота и купить сено. Поэтому Шамши и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку строительных материалов для перекрытия крыши сарая и приобретение 300 тюков сена в качестве корма для скота. Теплый сарай и свежий корм позволят Шамши получить весной здоровый приплод. В будущем она планирует увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Shamshi is 48 years old, married and has two children. Shamshi has secondary education. She has worked with agriculture for many years. Currently she has three cows, one horse and ten sheep on her farm. She also rents a plot of land of 1.40 hectares and owns a plot of land of 0.87 hectares. 

Shamshi grows barley and potatoes to sell. She also sells milk every day. The monthly income is on average 7,000 som (KGS). Shamshi is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. She strives to invest all the money she gets from her business in further developing her business. 

This year Shamshi decided to cover the roof of the livestock barn and purchase hay. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS), which she will direct to purchasing building materials for covering the roof of the barn and 300 bales of hay as fodder for the livestock. 

A warm barn and fresh fodder will allow Shamshi to get healthy offspring from the livestock in the spring. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cttle.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to cover the roof of her barn and to buy hay for livestock fodder

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, reside en el distrito de Morropón junto a su familia, es natural de la zona. La comunidad donde vive es un lugar en donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Y su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que se dedica Gloria es a la venta de abarrotes, plástico, y crianza y venta de aves de corral(patos, cuyre, ect), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 05 años Gloria cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y económicas. El destino del crédito será para mejora de su vivienda pues desea colocar piso a toda su casa para de esta forma darle mayor comodidad a su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old. She is single. She lives in the Morropón district with her family. She is a native of the area. The residents in her community work in agriculture, ranching and business. The community has basic services like water and electricity. It is located in the Morropón district and province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú.

Gloria sells groceries and  plastic products. She also raises and sells poultry (ducks, etc.). She has done this work for more than five years. Gloria has a steady clientele with good personal, working and business references. The loan will be used to improve her home. She wants to put flooring everywhere in her house to give more comfort to her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: improve her home, she want to put flooring eveywhere

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Albina, 45, a very ambitious and enterprising go-getter who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of four and has been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary sources of income are from selling eggs and crops and from some personal business she does to make ends meet. 

Albina loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow. She really takes good care of her dairy cows. 

The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticultural farming, that is good soil, climate and transport system, as well as an existing market for horticulture products. Albina wants to take advantage of these conditions and start horticultural farming. 

She is seeking a loan to start this new enterprise. Through an increased income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. 

The financial benefits that Albina will reap will be almost immediate, hence she will be assured a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture products to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 38 years old entrepreneur residing in La, a district of Ghana with her husband. 

For 13 years, Doreen has been run a sachet water and fresh fish business. She operates at the market. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Doreen will make bulk purchases of sachet water and fresh fish to sell to customers. 

With the additional profits, Doreen hopes to expand her business and make a larger profit. She will work hard to take care of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase sachet water and fresh fish.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 41 years old, an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. and her husband is alone responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Zubaida has been doing her business of clothes selling for many years and contributes her income along with her husband to manage the household.

Zubaida needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes to sell. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Saratu Delu

texts.en:
Saratu Delu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu Delu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ashiru, Suleman and Sadic.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Delu had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Delu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Saratu Delu  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to store her harvest to hopefully sell later at a higher price.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a resident of Laguna, Philippines. She has children and works in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative.

Juanita is a quality control officer. She inspects garments, such as denim during manufacturing to spot defects per worker and reasons for rejecting the material by examiners. She counts pattern parts, lays of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operation and other measurement knowledge.

A dilemma for employees like Juanita, is the improper balance of their salaries with family expenses; and they have no access to savings or conventional credit.  It's a situation that puts people in heavy debt to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Juanita is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and had no problem returning it back since the loan payment was deducted from every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. 

Juanita will use the loan as her additional capital needed to improve her income from her variety store.

Juanita hopes for everyday wisdom and strength in her workplace. She also wants her family to always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. 

----------------------------

Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to support her variety store.

loans.name: Marus

texts.en:
Marus lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. She is 60 years old and she lives alone. Marus worked for 16 years at her city’s famous carpet factory as a spinner. After this factory closed, she decided to establish her own business. At the city’s wholesale market in a rented stall, she sells women's, men's and children's  clothes, coats, shoes and slippers (also for children), handbags, women's underwear, bed covers, etc. 

Marus has been in this business already for 10 years and she surely knows all the ways to have success in it and receive good profit from it. The proof of this can be her numerous regular customers who have always done their shopping at her stall for 10 years.

Marus is asking for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge her stall’s assortment with a winter season clothes collection.

loans.use: to enlarge her stall’s assortment with a winter season clothes collection

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 28 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children and husband. Rita has a sewing services and earns income to contribute to paying household expenses.

She needs tools and supplies, like needles, threads, pieces of cloth, a new sewing machine, etc.  Rita doesn't have the financial means to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase sewing supplies and hopefully increase her sales and profits.

Rita is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies for her stitching business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en:
Leah, 50, has eight children. As a group leader, she is representing 11 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya. 

Leah has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years, having joined the program the first time in 2011. Her decision to join the organization was largely a result of her desire to make more friends among farmers in her community. Although she describes her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Leah has decided to purchase a solar light with part of her loan, which she is very excited about. This purchase will allow her to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Leah's group will be able to receive nine solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr:
Tatu  fait partie du groupe  Baraka et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 39 ans  est mariée à Ally, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de  2 à 23 ans. 
Elle a sous sa charge son frère qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 9 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre   pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Tatu  is part of the group called Baraka and she lives in Bujumbura. She is 39 years old and married to Ally, a chauffeur. Together they have seven children aged from two to 23 years old. She is also responsible for her brother who is studying. 

Tatu has been selling clothing for nine years. She is on her seventh loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is receiving, she is going to grow her working capital and buy lots of clothing for resale so she can earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like her children to be able to study.

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy lots of clothing for resale

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо житель города Истаравшан. Ему 40 лет. Он родился в семье рабочих. Мирзо женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Он старается воспитать своих детей хорошими людьми. Мирзо вместе с семьей  живет в доме который построил сам. Мирзо таксист. Он уже  10 лет как занимается частным извозом людей  и знает все тонкости этого дела. Мирзо хочет отремонтировать свой автомобиль и подготовить на зимний период,  но для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Вот по этому он пришел в МДО Арванд для получение кредита. ОН заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Mirzo is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. He is 40 years old. He was born in a working family. Mirzo is married and has three children. He has a very friendly family. He strives to raise his children to be good people. Mirzo and his family live in a home which he built himself. 

Mirzo is a taxi driver. He has worked as a private taxi driver for 10 years already, and he knows all the details of the business. Mirzo would like to repair his car and prepare for the winter, however he needs money to do this. For this reason he went to MDO Arvand to get a loan. He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the support and confidence.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his car

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе 39 лет. Она уроженка района Спитамен. Спинамен находиться на северной территории Таджикистана недалеко от города Худжанд. Наргиза работает медсестрой в одном из учреждений района. В этой деятельности она работает около 5 лет. У нее не большая зарплата и Наргиза дополнительно дома держит скотин. Чтобы они обеспечили семью молоком и мясом. Наргиза прекрасно справляется на работе и у нее остается много времени после работы. Она хочет потратить время с пользой. Наргиза решила всерьез заняться скотоводством. На заемные деньги она купит несколько голов скотин. Наргиза надеется постепенно развивать деятельность и стать успешной предпринимателем. Наргиза верит, что ей не откажут в помощи, и заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 39 years old. She is a resident of the Spitamen region. Spitamen is in the northern part of Tajikistan, not far from the city of Khujand. Nargiza works as a nurse at one of the institutions in the area. She has worked with this for around 5 years. She does not have a large pay and therefore she also keeps cattle, in order to provide the family with milk and meat. 

Nargiza does a very good job and she has a lot of time after work. She would like to spend this time usefully. She decided to engage more seriously in cattle breeding. With the borrowed money she will purchase a few heads of cattle. She hopes to develop her business gradually and become a successful entrepreneur. Nargiza believes that she will get help and thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to start a livestock breeding business

loans.name: Kakda

texts.en:
Kakda is 19 years old and also a second-year student taking an English for Communication major at an institute. She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Kakda would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees. With this loan, she will be able to graduate successfully. After graduation, she is going to find a good job. In the future, if she has children, she will support them to have a higher education.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Kamariddin

texts.en:
Kamariddin was born in 1972 and lives with his family in south Tajikistan. He is industrious man and always cares of his children. He has three children. 

He began his clothes sales business 15 years ago. He developed his business little by little. He sells clothes in a local market.. 

Kamariddin want to increase business and maximize profit.  He is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy clothes for new winter season.

With good credit history behind him, Kamariddin hopes for the support and trust of his lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for new winter season.

loans.name: Ericka Yelixsa

texts.es:
Ericka Yelixsa tiene 25 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y 02 hijos en el caserio San Luis del distrito de Morropón, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios basicos como son agua y luz. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Ericka Yelixsa es la venta de abarrotes, actividad que realiza hace más de 06 años, contando con clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, pues comprará más productos de primera necesidad, para surtir la bodega, lo cual le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos y ampliar su negocio. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas ya que pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas formales. Ericka Yelixsa piensa trabajar otorgando producto nuevos y con más bajos precios, al de la competencia, lo cual le ayudará a fidelizar a su clientela, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ericka Yelixsa is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and her two children in the San Luis hamlet in the district of Morropón. The local population work in agriculture, live-stock farming and commerce. The area has basic services such as water and electricity. Her community is located in the district and province of Morropón, in the region of Piura, on the north coast of Peru. 

Ericka Yelixsa sells groceries. She has been doing so for more than 6 years and has a steady customer base. The loan will be invested in working capital; she will buy more basic commodity products to stock up her store.This will help her to generate more income and expand her business. The market has good prospects because the local population work in formal enterprises. Ericka Yelixsa is looking to offer new products and lower prices than the competition, which will help her gain customer loyalty. In the short term this will help her increase her income and improve her profits and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more basic commodity products

loans.name: Nhóm 06_Thôn 7_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Lý, 50, is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06_thôn 07_Minh Châu solidarity group, which comprises four members. 

Lý has a retail business selling dry foods. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Her main hardship in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to sell.

In 2013, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from FPW. 

With her business profits, she hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to sell

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

Jerilyn has been in this business for 10 years and also earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to build her businesses.

Jerilyn has sustained her business through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Thel Shg Group

texts.en:
Tejmala is a very active woman who rear pigs for sustenance. She is 55 years old, devoted to social services in her locality and takes an active role among the women's groups in the locality for the betterment of the society. 

“I want the world to be a good place free from all kinds of social evil, and I am contributing in my capability to create my dream world through women groups,” she said. 

Tejmala is pictured with her hand raised, and she is the featured borrower of the group. She has been rearing pigs for the last few years as an option for self-reliance. “It has been very helpful for me because it is the only way to be independent in financial matters.” 

Both she and her husband are farmers. They both work in the field to grow crops for their own consumption and sell the surplus production as a means of income generation. They lead simple lives, and their mode of cultivation is still a primary mode involving lots of physical strength. As they are growing older, they cannot produce more. Rearing piglets and chickens at home is much easier and comfortable for income generation at their age, as it does not require heavy physical strength. 

She will buy piglets with the Kiva loan. The income she makes from the piggery business will be used for their household expenses and to pay other fees. She also hopes to save some amount as security to pay for their medical fees in the near future. She is very happy with the loan. 

The rest of the group members are engaged in similar business including piggeries, weaving and farming. They are all very excited to get the loan and will make maximum use of it to promote their businesses. They express their immense gratitude to all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy piglets to rear.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Dos mujeres de 18 y 25 años de edad y una mujer de 11 años son la esperanza y el motor de vida de la señora Alexandra quien ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos con un negocio de venta de comidas, arrastrando su carro pro las calles buscando una venta para volver a casa con un bocado de comida.
Para ajustar es una madre soltera cabeza de familia y a pesar de todas las dificultades siempre sonreí pues tiene que mostrar fortaleza a sus hijos.
Con el crédito comprara llantas, parasol, termos y adaptara una vitrina para hacer su carro algo novedoso e impactante para el público.
Su sueño es poder algún día comprar una casa propia y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Two women who are 18 and 25 and 11 year old girl are the hope and motivation in the life of Alexandra. She supports her three children with a business selling food, driving her vehicle through the streets looking for a sale, to then return home with a bite of food. 
She is a single mother and head of her household. Despite all of the difficulties, she always smiles because she has to show strength to her children. With the loan, she will purchase tires, an umbrella and thermoses. She will adapt a display case to do something new with her vehicle and make an impact on the public. 
Her dream is to purchase a home and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: purchase tires, an umbrella, thermoses and supplies.

loans.name: Nicholus' Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nicholus, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married, a father to three children, and is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Nicholus joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Nicholus plans to buy a cow.

Between the 10 farmers in Nicholus's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en:
Insaf, 62, is a married mother of five children. Due to her husband's low financial situation, and increasing living costs, she decided three years ago to start selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Today, Insaf is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Insaf hopes to expand her business more in the future, especially in the children's clothing section, to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and married, and has four children.

She earns a living rice farming in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for land preparation, and to buy fertilizer.

Cecilia has been farming rice for 24 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cecilia is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation, and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 53 years old, and she lives in Yerevan city. She graduated Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, and she is a teacher of elementary classes. Now she works at the school, and she already has 35 years of pedagogical experience. 

Natela also helps some pupils (these are paid group courses) after school to get prepared for their lessons, and she also explains to them unclear and difficult themes of the day. 

Natela is a patient and clever pedagogue greatly respected in the school where she works. 

Natela is married, and she has two daughters (they are married already) and a son; he is a successful businessman and runs his own fruit and vegetable trading business.

This loan will be great for Natela, since she needs to buy a computer and professional literature, as she says nowadays for a pedagogue, these two things are very important in order to organize and make the teaching process more interesting and informative.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature, in order to organize and make the teaching process more interesting and informative

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, pictured above, is a group leader, and is representing his group,which was formed by 6 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Ibrahim will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Purchasing a solar light with part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Ibrahim plans to use the profits he gains this year to buy a cow.

Ibrahim’s Group will use the money received from this loan to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Haladu

texts.en:
Haladu is a maize farmer from the village of Sabon Gida in Kaduna state, Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haladu had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Haladu can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest.

Haladu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet immediate expenses like food and clothing, thus eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Hauwa, Yahaya and Zainab.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Magaji  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food and child school fees, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, a food vendor, is married and lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her community. She is pictured here cooking food to sell.

Norma is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for cooking, such as meat, vegetables and condiments. With this investment, she will be able to cook more and sell more to her customers.

In the future, Norma hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, such as meat, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: 22-Senor De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Hipolita es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hija mujer de 10 años y un hijo varón de 14 años, y su negocio es el tejido en lana a máquina.
Ella es sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 16 de julio, una zona caracterizada por la feria, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser ropa hasta un tractor para sembrar la tierra. De clima frío (4-12 grados centígrados) y rayos solares muy fuertes que pueden quemar la piel, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Hipolita es una mujer de tez morena, estatura mediana, viste tradicionalmente (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua nativa es el aymará y habla español porque vive en la ciudad (sentada al centro, manta a rayas negro/marrón, mandil celeste). Su vida la realiza con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en casa de su abuela desde hace 41 años y está construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su deseo por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la llevó a conformar una banca de cholitas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de pantalones, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería,  para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de lana a máquina, ella viene tejiendo desde hace 15 años en su domicilio, prendas como; suéter de hombre y de mujer, bufandas, gorros, chalecos, etc. para la venta por mayor a clientes constantes y también ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante a comerciantes del rubro, debido a las ventas de fin de año sus pedidos aumentaron y para poder entregarlos necesita su materia prima principal; lana en cantidad. Esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, y desea realizar la compra de lana por mayor para tejerla y entregar sus pedidos de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Hipolita solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor y abastecer con tejidos a sus clientes de fin de año.
texts.en:
Hipolita is a 41 year old woman. She's single, has a 10 year old daughter and a son who's 14. Her business is weaving wool by machine. She is sincere, intelligent, generous, comprehensive, entrepreneurial, responsible and hard-working. 

She does her business in the 16 de julio region, a zone known for its fair, where you can find anything from a needle to sew clothing to a tractor to sew seeds. The zone has a cold climate (4-12 degrees Celsius) and very strong sun rays that can burn skin. It's at a high altitude, 3800 meters above sea level.

Hipolita has a dark complexion and is of medium height. She dresses traditionally (blanket, skirt and hat) and her native language is Aymara. She speaks spanish because she lives in the city. In the photo, she's seated in the center with the black/brown striped blanket and blue apron.

She lives her life with her children who are in school. They have lived in her grandmother's house for 41 years, which is made of brick and has potable water, electricity and gas. 

Her desire to improve her family's quality of life led her to join a women's bank with business like food sales, soft drink sales, pants sales, weaving clothes for babies, french fry sales, athletic clothing sales and a neighborhood store and butchery, to seek a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is weaving wool fabrics by machine. She's been weaving for 15 years in her home, making items like women'a and men's sweaters, scarves, caps, vests, etc. to sell in bulk to her regular clients. She also sells her products while traveling to sellers in the industry. 

Due to the end-of-year sales, her orders have increased. To be able to fill them, she needs primary materials: bulk wool. This is the fifth series of loans within the institution in the 15 years she's been in this business. Her dream is to have a fixed point of sale, and she wants to purchase wholesale wool to weave it and fill her end-of-year orders. Because of these goals, Hipolita seeks a loan to buy wool in bulk and supply her customers with fabrics at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool and supply their customers with fabrics at the end of the year.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Inusa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lawan, Abdulwahabu, and Abdussalam.  

In the past, because he needed to pay urgent expenses, Inusa would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but when the price was lowest.

However, now that he is a member, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more.  

When asked, Inusa spoke of his ambition to educate his children with the additional income he earns. He also hopes to help lift other members of his community out of poverty.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and his children's school fees, eliminating the pressure to sell his harvest at low prices.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 16 novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier et des alentours. La plupart fait du commerce. Les femmes entretiennent de très bonnes relations et s'entraident.
Ndeye, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle projette de faire de la transformation d'arachide en huile et aussi soutenir son fils dans le commerce de bijoux. Avec le crédit, elle compte investir 180000 F à l'achat d'arachide. le prix d'achat lui revient à 175 F le Kg. Elle va ensuite transformer l'arachide en huile et le revendre au prix de 900 F le litre. Avec le reste de l'argent, à savoir les 150000 F, elle compte aider son fils qui est bijoutier pour renforcer son activité.
Avec les bénéfices, elle soutient son mari dans la gestion des besoins de la famille en l'occurrence les frais de scolarité de ses 04 enfants qui vont à l'école et renforcer la dépense. Elle va aussi épargner et payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This group of six members is a part of the banc villageois that was created 16 November 2009. This group of women live in the same area and surrounds. Most work in commerce. They have a very good relationship and help each other.

Ndeye, who is standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. She works making groundnuts into oil and also supports her son's business selling jewelry.

With this loan, she plans to invest 180,000 francs into the buying of groundnuts, which sell for 175 francs per kilogram. She is going to then make the groundnuts into oil and resell it at 900 francs per liter.

With the rest of her loan, which totals about 150,000 francs, she plans to help her son with his business as a jeweler.

With her earnings, she plans to support her husband take care of the family's expenses, including four of their children's school fees. She also will put some of her earnings in savings and pay the interest [on her part of the loan].

loans.use: to make groundnut oil to resell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gracias a una tía que vio en ella potencial y pasión por la cría de ganado porcino gloria pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de cerdos, fundando su empresa formalmente en el año 2010, Madre de un hijo ya mayor de edad y a sus 45 años se permite soñar con un negocio sostenible, con poder mejorar su vivienda, con mejorar sus ventas y toda su vida.
Gloria quiere solicitar un crédito que usara en la compra de concentrado que es comida para sus cerdos y una cerda de cría para aumentar sus animales con el paso del tiempo.
Su sueño y su meta son ir progresando cada día y demostrar que el emprendimiento fue la mejor opción para solventar sus necesidades económicas
texts.en:
Thanks to an aunt who saw her potential and passion for raising and breeding pigs, Gloria was able to start her business selling pigs.  She founded her business officially in 2010. She is the mother one adult son, and at 45 years of age she is allowing herself to dream of a sustainable business, the ability to improve her home and her sales, and her life as a whole.

Gloria is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase pig feed and a breeding sow to increase the number of her animals over time.  Her dream and goal is to make progress every day and show that this undertaking is the best option to meet her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and a breeding sow to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik is an agronomist from the Shvanidzor community in the Meghri region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and son.
 
Satenik takes care of her beautiful orchard, where a large variety of fruit trees grow (peach, apricot, cherry, plum, quince, pomegranate, persimmon and nuts). For many years, she has gathered a perfect harvest of fruits from her orchard, which is a very important source of income for her family. 

Satenik will be very thankful if lenders would be so kind as to give her this loan, which she will use to purchase 300 pomegranate and persimmon saplings and fertilizer and to pay for labour costs.

Because this is Satenik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy 300 pomegranate and persimmon saplings and fertilizer and to pay for labour

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero. No tiene hijos vive con su padre quien se encuentra de avanzada edad, vive en el caserío el Pedregal, distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de lima el de mayor producción, así como al comercio caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.

Julian se dedica a la ganadería, cría y comercio de ganado caprino, él los comercializa en el puerto de Chiple todos los viernes día de plaza comercial, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de ganado caprino para comercio, invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable, pues en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julian is 55 years old and single. He does not have children and lives with his father, who is very old. He lives in the village of Pedregal in the Pomahuaca district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the Sierra Norte of Peru. The population earns a living through agriculture, being the largest-producing grower of limes, as a medium-sized village trade with growth aspirations.

Julian earns a living through livestock, raising and selling goats. He sells them in the port of Chiple every Friday at the shopping plaza. He has over 15 years of experience in the industry and has very good personal, work and creditor references. 

The loan is to invest in the business buying goats to sell, investing in his business and acquiring an acceptable profit and in the short-term to improve his income, increase his profits and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy goats for trade.

loans.name: Norbey

texts.es:
Norbey un hombre de 29 años de edad que se desempeña como distribuidor de alimentos en una empresa que el mismo fundo y ha tenido en pie gracias a sus habilidades y ganas de salir adelante que mediante un crédito quiere prosperar con la ayuda del micro-crédito con el que comprara surtido en barquillos y productos de panadería. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito espera generar ingresos para ayudar a su pareja, a su hijo, a sus familiares. 
Con este crédito podrá mejorar su inventario, y queda en sus manos sacar adelante este proyecto que ha sido tan agradecido con él pues su familia puede disfrutar de una alimentación y una vida digna.
texts.en:
Norbey is a 29 year old man who works as a distributor of foods in a business he's funded himself. His business has been standing thanks to his abilities and desire to get ahead. With a loan, it will prosper with the help of microcredit, with which he'll buy an assortment of waffles and bakery products.

With the help of this loan, he wants to generate income to help his partner, her son and his family. With this loan he will be able to improve his inventory. It's up to him to move this project forward so his family, which has been so pleased with him, can enjoy food and a decent life.

loans.use: to improve his inventory with bread products.
